"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-06-28 07:12:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/924bcc130e6bdc28d9a0a1605eb552fbc7043cae', 'message': "Remove `with_lockmode` use from Trust SQL backend.

Due to the lack of support of `SELECT .. FOR UPDATE` call in
MySQL + Galera, the use of `with_lockmode('update')` needs to be
removed from the Trust SQL backend when utilizing the MySQL
dialect.

Instead of the pessimistic locking method (row lock, table lock),
use optimistic locking. The consume_use method now attempts to
update the remaining_uses column for the trust in question only
if the remaining_uses equal the same number as on the initial
query. This is done in a loop with a 10-iteration failsafe to
prevent endless looping.

Change-Id: I1b8af6ce5709f829f345cd351ec9242d0217e743
Closes-Bug: #1325143
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2014-06-28 07:47:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/f3fd8a8027ef519e1872443ea0840f0f561c1802', 'message': "Remove `with_lockmode` use from Trust SQL backend.

use optimistic locking. The consume_use method now attempts to
update the remaining_uses column for the trust in question only
if the remaining_uses equal the same number as on the initial
query. This is done in a loop with a 10-iteration failsafe to
prevent endless looping.

commit_message:
Remove `with_lockmode` use from Trust SQL backend.

Due to the lack of support of `SELECT .. FOR UPDATE` call in
MySQL + Galera, the use of `with_lockmode('update')` needs to be
removed from the Trust SQL backend when utilizing the MySQL
dialect.

Instead of the pessimistic locking method (row lock, table lock),
use optimistic locking. The consume_use method now attempts to
update the remaining_uses column for the trust in question only
if the remaining_uses equal the same number as on the initial
query. This is done in a loop with a 10-iteration failsafe to
prevent endless looping.

Change-Id: I1b8af6ce5709f829f345cd351ec9242d0217e743
Closes-Bug: #1325143
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/59/97059/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import contextlib import uuid from keystone.openstack.common import logLOG = log.getLogger(__name__) 'remaining_uses', 'lock'] lock = sql.Column(sql.String(32), nullable=True)@contextlib.contextmanager def _lock_trust_record(trust_id): """Lock a specific trust record in the DB. This method should be used to lock a specific row in the DB with a unique identifier. This is a workaround for the known issue with MySQL+Galera and the 'SELECT ... FOR UPDATE' issues. Locking will only occur if the engine is MySQL, the trust is limited use, the trust is not deleted, and the trust is currently not locked. This context manager will yield a uuid lock_id if the dialect is MySQL, otherwise it will yield NoneType. :param trust_id: The Trust Identifier :return: None """ session = sql.get_session() lock_info = None if session.bind.name == 'mysql': try: # NOTE(morganfainberg): Only need this if we are under mysql. lock_info = uuid.uuid4().hex with sql.transaction() as session: (session.query(TrustModel). filter_by(deleted_at=None). filter_by(id=trust_id). filter_by(remaining_uses=None). filter_by(lock=None).update({'lock': lock_info})) except sql.NotFound: # NOTE(morganfainberg): Either the trust is gone or already # locked. It is the responsibility of the method using the context # to figure out if the trust is locked or gone. pass # NOTE(morganfainberg): The lock_info can be used externally to # check that the context still holds the lock before performing any # updates. yield lock_info if lock_info: try: with sql.transaction() as session: (session.query(TrustModel). filter_by(deleted_at=None). filter_by(id=trust_id). filter_by(lock=lock_info).update({'lock': None})) except sql.NotFound: # NOTE(morganfainberg): If we can't find the record to unlock # there is no reason we should be raising an error, the record # may have been deleted or the lock got mangled up. LOG.debug('Unable to find locked trust with id %(trust_id)s and ' 'lock %(lock_id)s', {'trust_id': trust_id, 'lock_id': lock_info}) pass with _lock_trust_record(trust_id) as lock_id: with sql.transaction() as session: if lock_id is None: # NOTE(morganfainberg): lock_id will be None if the dialect # is not mysql, meaning we can use `with_lockmode`. ref = (session.query(TrustModel). with_lockmode('update'). filter_by(deleted_at=None). filter_by(id=trust_id).first()) else: ref = (session.query(TrustModel). filter_by(deleted_at=None). filter_by(id=trust_id).first()) if ref is None: raise exception.TrustNotFound(trust_id=trust_id) if ref.remaining_uses is None: # unlimited uses, do nothing pass elif lock_id is not None and ref.lock != lock_id: raise exception.TrustLocked(trust_id=trust_id, expected_lock=lock_id, actual_lock=ref.lock) elif ref.remaining_uses > 0: ref.remaining_uses -= 1 else: raise exception.TrustUseLimitReached(trust_id=trust_id)
deleted_lines: 'remaining_uses', 'r_lock'] with sql.transaction() as session: ref = (session.query(TrustModel). with_lockmode('update'). filter_by(deleted_at=None). filter_by(id=trust_id).first()) if ref is None: raise exception.TrustNotFound(trust_id=trust_id) if ref.remaining_uses is None: # unlimited uses, do nothing pass elif ref.remaining_uses > 0: ref.remaining_uses -= 1 else: raise exception.TrustUseLimitReached(trust_id=trust_id)

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but tempest unittests don't currently

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but tempest unittests don't currently
pass a with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Change-Id: Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a

commit_message:
Fix tab show/shown handlers for bootstrap v3

Also remove preventDefault() call from tab 'show' handler -
with that call it required 2 clicks to switch to a
lazy-loaded tab.

Change-Id: I4ba55c6f750cb9724287d5a9f2297666c0cece01
Closes-Bug: #1347002
Closes-Bug: #1350117

commit_message:
Add valid method check for quota resources

ReservableResource and CountableResource comes down to
the method used to count the in-use
resources.  For ReservableResource, the count is based on the number of
database objects matching the project ID, whereas with
CountableResource, a counting function has to be specified; otherwise,
the classes are identical and designed to be used identically.indeed,
CountableResource extends ReservableResource and only overrides the
constructor.

This patch add some sanity-checking to limit_check() and
reserve() that ensure that they only work with the correct resource
type(s)

Change-Id: Ibec048a5d8c2c4a8685f5f3cc2076c64b39654a3
Partial-Bug: #1301532
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/110863/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _valid_method_call_check_resources(resources, 'check') _valid_method_call_check_resources(resources, 'reserve') def _valid_method_call_check_resource(name, method): if method not in ['reserve', 'check']: raise exception.InvalidQuotaMethodUsage(method=method, res=name) res = [r for r in resources if r.name == name] if len(res) != 1: raise exception.InvalidQuotaMethodUsage(method=method, res=name) reserve = isinstance(res[0], AbsoluteResource) and method == 'reserve' check = isinstance(res[0], ReservableResource) and method == 'check' if reserve or check: raise exception.InvalidQuotaMethodUsage(method=method, res=name) def _valid_method_call_check_resources(resource, method): """A method to check whether the resource can use the quota method.""" for name in resource.keys(): _valid_method_call_check_resource(name, method)

commit_message:
Code to pass through transport_key_id when storing secret

This can happen in either a PUT or a GET request.  The
SecretStorePluginManager must return the plugin corresponding to
the transport_key_id, and must pass the transport_key as part
of the SecretDTO, so that the plugin will know the contents are
encrypted.

Implements: blueprint add-wrapping-key-to-barbican-server
Change-Id: Ieaa2bb7881cd34bcd891764945ef3c159062d4d4

commit_message:
replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems(dict)

According to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 dict.iteritems()
should be replaced with six.iteritems(dict).

Change-Id: I9e2881a006433c8b44a3caccebc73bae4973a041

subject: Move elements from ubuntu-guest to mysql and percona
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-29 13:59:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration/commit/79bf7f06238d5c5e5930d0698c5b033c54376421', 'message': "Move elements from ubuntu-guest to mysql and percona

the ubuntu-guest element are only relevant for mysql and percona guest

commit_message:
Move elements from ubuntu-guest to mysql and percona

The files 20-apparmor-mysql-local and 50-percona-server which were in
the ubuntu-guest element are only relevant for mysql and percona guest
agents and therefore having them in ubuntu-guest is not ideal. While
not catastrophic, it does mean that these settings show up in all
guest images.

The files have been relocated to ubuntu-mysql and ubuntu-percona. The
file that adds the percona key has been put in a newly created
pre-install.d directory and renamed. The other (apparmor) has
similarly been moved into this new pre-install.d directory.

Change-Id: I6e8fd0fde37ee9689b9f6a669a33d579b2ba6c64
Closes-Bug: #1349553

subject: xenapi: Do not retry snapshot upload on 500
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-29 15:58:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/72b2babdab2b564ce71efae8fc4703a743b77658', 'message': 'xenapi: Do not retry snapshot upload on 500

If Glance returns a 500 response on an initial attempt to upload
a snapshot image, it will set the image status to KILLED/DELETED.
Any retry attempts will fail with a 409 response.

Hence, Nova should not attempt to retry the upload in this case, which
will eliminate many pointless retries.

Closes-Bug: 1349933

Change-Id: I1a8f2416923a368b02cf8963c747ebbb24d749a1
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-29 16:16:43.000000000', 'files': ['plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/77aea0e6a3d77f3c747a3f0d7126a8fbfae94263', 'message': 'xenapi: Do not retry snapshot upload on 500

If Glance returns a 500 response on an initial attempt to upload
a snapshot image, it will set the image status to killed.  Any retry
attempts will fail with a 409 response.

Hence, Nova should not attempt to retry the upload in this case, which
will eliminate many pointless retries.

Closes-Bug: 1349933

Change-Id: I1a8f2416923a368b02cf8963c747ebbb24d749a1
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Do not retry snapshot upload on 500

If Glance returns a 500 response on an initial attempt to upload
a snapshot image, it will set the image status to killed.  Any retry
attempts will fail with a 409 response.

Hence, Nova should not attempt to retry the upload in this case, which
will eliminate many pointless retries.

Closes-Bug: 1349933

Change-Id: I1a8f2416923a368b02cf8963c747ebbb24d749a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/49/110349/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 17:09:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/054bd8f4e0cab87df1b0242e0d280fbf2e43d5d7', 'message': "Expose {set,get}_boot_device in the API

A new /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device subresource added exposing
ways to the client to {set,get} the boot device for a node.

* To set a boot device:

 PUT {'boot_device': 'pxe' } /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device

* To get the current boot device:

 GET /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device[/supported]

 The /supported flag is used to list all the boot devices that is
 supported for that node.

blueprint: promote-set-boot-device

commit_message:
Expose {set,get}_boot_device in the API

A new /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device subresource added exposing
ways to the client to {set,get} the boot device for a node.

* To set a boot device:

 PUT {'boot_device': 'pxe' } /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device[?persistent=<bool>]

* To get the current boot device:

 GET /nodes/<uuid>/management/boot_device[/supported]

 The /supported flag is used to list all the boot devices that is
 supported for that node.

Implements: blueprint new-management-interface
Change-Id: I7ab93b95112efb69cf7b2daab6bbd925cb2d1e02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/51/90151/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.14 - Added set_boot_device and get_boot_device. RPC_API_VERSION = '1.14' def set_boot_device(self, context, node_id, device, topic=None): """Set the boot device for a node. Set the boot device to use on next reboot of the node. Be aware that not all drivers support this. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param device: the boot device, one of :mod:`ironic.common.boot_devices`. :raises: NodeLocked if node is locked by another conductor. :raises: UnsupportedDriverExtension if the node's driver doesn't support console. :raises: InvalidParameterValue when the wrong driver info is specified or an invalid boot device is specified. :raises: NotSupportedByDriver if setting the boot device is not supported by the driver. """ return self.call(context, self.make_msg('set_boot_device', node_id=node_id, device=device), topic=topic or self.topic) def get_boot_device(self, context, node_id, supported, topic=None): return self.call(context, self.make_msg('get_boot_device', node_id=node_id, supported=supported), topic=topic or self.topic)

commit_message:
Rename ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-deploy -> *-driver

The blueprint which is referenced by this spec is named
ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver. This name is correctly linked from
line 6 within the spec. However, the spec itself is misnamed.

This patch renames the spec file so that it matches the corresponding
blueprint.

Change-Id: I178be5cf55952e3ff674be121e19f2da3846eff5

commit_message:
Fixes and cleanups for missing lables

* Moved release notes to other pdf files. Building them as
  a separate job is not only pointless but also doesn't
  allow referencing other chapters with :ref tag from the
  release notes.

* Cleaned some broken references and labels.

Change-Id: I8029b6e165450214c01113818a29d9102a53cd30

commit_message:
Simple refactor to stop passing around an unused parameter

There is no functional change in this patch.  However, this refactor
allows another patch [1] to make a simpler change to the code base.

This patch includes localizing the initialization of "internal_cidrs"
to a later spot in the "process_router" method.  This has the
advantage that it will be initialized under the same condition that it
will be used.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/109776

Change-Id: I3ca993d0a33b7c925526099e97999c9d9f76efc2

commit_message:
Fixed dependency on trove for int-tests

Cleaned up int-test dependencies so that the core int-test groups
are now registered entirely from trove python module. This enables
adding new int-tests for features in trove without creating a cross
repository dependency in trove-integration.

Change-Id: I13fad1179ea6d576d5b96592c8bf927037f51e7b
Closes-bug: 1343584

commit_message:
Fix spaceships

Then collector returns nothing we will end up with
null Class evaluation error. To fix it, use if defined().

Closes-bug: #1353340

Change-Id: Ic329bdd6ae7c91ef693263f5b84d1f0910ca962b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to disable ceilometer-collector without db

You are no longer required to include ceilometer::db when
disabling ceilometer-collector using the enabled parameter.

The relationships with any database resources are now only enforced
when the service is enabled.

Closes-bug: #1352958
Change-Id: I00a5e651184788acdd30de1908e2bf38566f78e1

commit_message:
Implement topology api

Implements: blueprint replication-v1

Change-Id: If35ea2507345bffb87eb7e9503f92dd43c023384
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/70/87970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Rackspace Hosting # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Model classes that form the core of Topology functionality """ import json from trove.common import exception from trove.db import models from trove.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from trove.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def persisted_models(): return {'instance_topologies': DBTopologies} class DBTopologies(models.DatabaseModelBase): _data_fields = ['id', 'instance_id', 'datastore', 'topology', 'created', 'updated', 'deleted', 'deleted_at'] preserve_on_delete = False _table_name = 'instance_topologies' class Topology(object): def __init__(self, context, instance_id, **kwargs): """ Create an instance of Topology. This represents a row within the topology table for a given instance. This class should not be called directly, rather use the Topologies model class and act upon topologies as a dictionary. """ datastore = kwargs.get('datastore') topology = kwargs.get('topology') topology_entry = kwargs.get('topology_entry') if context and topology_entry: # A pre-instantiated topology entry was passed in, favor this. self.topology_entry = topology_entry elif context and instance_id and datastore and not topology: # We have everything we need to find an entry in the database self.topology_entry = DBTopologies.find_by( context=context, instance_id=instance_id, datastore=datastore) elif context and instance_id and datastore and topology: # Last chance, create a new one self.topology_entry = DBTopologies.create(context=context, datastore=datastore, topology=topology) self.save() else: # Nowhere else to go, gotta raise raise exception.TopologyModelError(model_name="Topology") @property def datastore(self): return self.topology_entry.datastore @property def topology(self): return self.topology_entry.topology def save(self): self.topology_entry.save() def delete(self): self.topology_entry.delete() def set_datastore(self, datastore): self.topology.datastore = datastore self.save() def set_topology(self, topology): self.topology_entry.topology = topology self.save() def __dict__(self): return { self.datastore: self.topology } class Topologies(object): def __init__(self, context, instance_id): """ Create an instance of Topologies. This represents the topology of a given trove instance. This satisfies the dictionary interface to keep interacting with the topology simple. """ self.context = context self.instance_id = instance_id def _load_topologies(self): """ Helper method for refreshing topology from the database. This is called at instantiation and anytime topology is added to the instance. """ # NOTE(imsplitbit): if this becomes too expensive of an operation we # can break it out into 2 methods. One for when instantiation happens # and one for just loading the newly created topology entries into # the self.topologies list. Ideally this would only contain one or two # topologies for a given datastore and this is done with a key based # SELECT so it should be an extremely fast operation. if self.context: self.topologies = DBTopologies.find_all( instance_id=self.instance_id, deleted=False).all() self.topologies = [Topology(self.context, t) for t in self.topologies] else: # if context is None you get nothing. self.topologies = [] LOG.info(_('Topologies: %s') % self.topologies) def __iter__(self): for topology in self.topologies: yield topology.datastore def __len__(self): LOG.info(_('Getting length of topologies')) return len(self.topologies) def __getitem__(self, item): for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == item: return topology.topology def __delitem__(self, item): for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == item: topology.delete() self._load_topologies() def __setitem__(self, key, value): # NOTE(imsplitbit): There is a known issue here where users of # this model will need to act upon each key/value pair in whole # because the topology values are stored in marshaled form so there # is no way to do an operation on nested objects. # If new topology is created we will want to reload all topology from # the db after successful creation force_reload = False found_topology = None for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == key: # The key already exists so this an update operation found_topology = topology found_topology.set_topology(json.dumps(value)) if not found_topology: # This isn't an update operation so make a new topology entry force_reload = True DBTopologies.create(instance_id=self.instance_id, datastore=key, topology=json.dumps(value)).save() # Now reload topology from the DB so as to keep all data current in # the instance variable self.topologies if force_reload: self._load_topologies() def __contains__(self, item): for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == item: return True return False def __eq__(self, other): # use self.copy() to render a dictionary and then allow python's # dict builtin to do the comparison. return self.copy() == other def __ne__(self, other): # use self.copy() to render a dictionary and then allow python's # dict builtin to do the comparison. return self.copy() != other def __repr__(self): # use self.copy() to render a dictionary and then allow python's # dict builtin __repr__ return self.copy().__repr__() def __str__(self): # use self.copy() to render a dictionary and then allow python's # dict builtin __str__ return self.copy().__str__() def __dict__(self): return self.copy() def keys(self): datastores = list() for topology in self.topologies: datastores.append(topology.datastore) return datastores def values(self): topologies = list() for topology in self.topologies: topologies.append(topology.topology) return topologies def items(self): items = list() for topology in self.topologies: items.append((topology.datastore, topology.topology)) return items def get(self, key, default=None): value = default for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == key: value = topology.topology return value def clear(self): for topology in self.topologies: topology.delete() self._load_topologies() def iterkeys(self): for datastore in self.keys(): yield datastore def pop(self, key): for topology in self.topologies: if topology.datastore == key: return topology.topology raise KeyError(key) def itervalues(self): for topology in self.values(): yield topology def iteritems(self): for item in self.items(): yield item def copy(self): result = {} for topology in self.topologies: result[topology.datastore] = topology.topology return result def save(self): """ Iterate through all Topology objects and call save() on them to synchronize them to the underlying database. """ for topology in self.topologies: topology.save()

commit_message:
Make sure L3 agent uses the latest RPC version

Previously the base RPC version was set to 1.0
even though both server and agent are currently
at version 1.1, as for the L3 RPC API's are
concerned.

Closes-bug: #1339184

Change-Id: Ic33cc090ce22514e8c4dce64e2fb7c6a11c480a7

commit_message:
iLO Virtual Media iSCSI Deploy Driver

Add ability to provision proliant baremetal nodes (having iLO4 and
beyond) by booting the baremetal node with virtual media and
using iscsi from conductor node to deploy the image (reusing
existing deploy mechanism).

Change-Id: Ib01518dda95b3bfb650c4eb469a9355311bfab02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/44/97744/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================== iLO Virtual Media Deploy Driver =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/ironic-ilo-virtualmedia-driver Add ability to provision proliant baremetal nodes (having iLO4 and beyond) by booting the baremetal node with virtual media. NOTE: This change is dependant on the below diskimage-builder change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97736 Problem description =================== - Today Ironic's PXE reference driver uses pxe protocol to boot the machine. Some customer's don't prefer PXE protocol in their environment. - Today Ironic's PXE reference driver passes the keystone authentication token in clear text over tftp on the data network to the baremetal node. Proposed change =============== The proposed change for Ironic deploy will happen in two stages: 1. Ironic conductor running ilo driver will do the preparations to boot the node with the deploy kernel/ramdisk using virtual media cdrom and passing necessary parameters and user token in virtual media floppy. 2. Baremetal node which is booted with deploy kernel/ramdisk will continue the installation and inform the conductor about the completion. Components changed or added --------------------------- - A new deploy module named 'IloVirtualMediaDeploy' which inherits from base.DeployInterface. This will implement the following interfaces: - validate() - deploy() - tear_down() The following methods will contain nothing: - prepare() - clean_up() - take_over() - A new vendor passthru module named 'IloVendorInterface' which inherits from base.VendorInterface. This will implement the following interfaces: - validate() - vendor_passthru() It will also add a new vendor_passthru method notify_completion which can be called with vendor_passthru. - The reboot() method in IloPower module (which will be added as part of this design spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97455 ) - Also the following new modules will be added: - ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/swift.py - This will handle interactions with swift to create and query temp url for swift objects. - ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/iso.py - This will handle creation of iso linux images. IloDeploy module ---------------- validate() ^^^^^^^^^^ - Validates that the node has advanced iLO license (for using the virtual media feature). If the node doesn't have advanced iLO license, it comes out with error. deploy() ^^^^^^^^ - If deploy_image doesn't have a glance meta-property 'deploy_iso': - Get the deploy kernel/ramdisk. This is is retrieved in either of the two ways below: - This will be mentioned as meta-properties deploy_kernel/deploy_ramdisk in glance for the deploy_image. - This will be mentioned in the ironic conf file. - Create a bootable isolinux image from the deploy kernel/ramdisk. A single command-line parameter boot_method='vmedia' will be passed as kernel argument for boot. - Upload the deploy iso to glance. - Add a meta-property deploy_iso to the deploy_image in glance. The value of this property will be the UUID of the deploy iso. This will enable this deploy_iso to be used for future deployments with the same deploy_image. - Get the value of meta-property deploy_iso for the deploy_image. - Generate the swift temp url for deploy_image. Let it be named as deploy_image_temp_url. - Create a virtual floppy image containing the user token and a config file, which contains the required information for deploy. The user token is used for informing the ironic conductor the completion status of deploy. The config file will contain the following information: + ironic_api_url + os_image_temp_url + node_uuid + is_disk_image + root_mb + swap_mb + ephemeral_mb + ephemeral_format + preserve_ephemeral - Upload the virtual floppy image to swift. Set X-Delete-After for swift to delete the image after 15 minutes. (using module swift.py) - Generate the swift temp url for deploy iso. Attach it as virtal media cdrom in the iLO. Set the timeout as 15 minutes. - Generate the swift temp url for virtual floppy image. Attach it as virtual media floppy in the iLO. Set the timeout as 15 minutes. - Set the baremetal node to boot from virtual media cdrom for the next boot using proliantutils.ilo module with BOOT_ONCE option. - Reset the server - Return the status as states.DEPLOYING tear_down() ^^^^^^^^^^^ - Power off the baremetal node. IloVendorInterface module ------------------------- validate() ^^^^^^^^^^ - Check if method called is one of the supported vendorpassthru methods. The only supported method is 'notify_completion' - Raise exception if method is not supported. vendor_passthru() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ - Find the method to be called from the internal mapping and call the method. notify_completion() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ *INPUT:* This will be recieved from the caller on the API call. - completion_status: 'pass' or 'fail' - error_reason: string for the error message if status was 'fail' - root_uuid: the uuid of the root partition generated with blkid command. *PROCEDURE:* - If the deploy_image has glance meta-property 'boot_kernel' and doesn't have a glance meta-property 'boot_iso': - Download the boot kernel/ramdisk from glance. This will be mentioned as meta-properties boot_kernel/boot_ramdisk. - Create a bootable isolinux image from the boot kernel/ramdisk. with a single command-line parameter root=<root_uuid> root partition contained within the deploy_image. This is recieved as an input for the vendor_passthru call. - Upload the boot iso to glance. - Add a meta-property boot_iso to the deploy_image. The value of this property will be the UUID of the boot iso. - Add a new property in node's driver_info 'boot_iso'. The value of this property will be glance image id of the boot iso. - Eject the virtual media cdrom and virtual media floppy. - Mark the deploy as states.DEPLOYDONE if deploy was successful. Mark the deploy as states.DEPLOYFAIL if deploy was unsuccessful. - Trigger the reboot with the reboot() method of IloPower module. IloPower module --------------- *NOTE*: IloPower module will be submitted as part of the design spec. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97455/ The reboot() method is modified as below: reboot() ^^^^^^^^ - If the node has a property boot_iso in its driver_info: - Generate the swift temp url for the boot_iso. Set the timeout as 15 minutes. Attach it as virtual media cdrom. - Set the baremetal node to boot from virtual media cdrom for the next boot using proliantutils.ilo module with BOOT_ONCE option. - Reset the server. ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/swift.py ----------------------------------- This module will handle the creation and managing swift objects. We need to following inputs from the user which will be provided in the ironic.conf file for the ilo group. - swift_url - This will be defaulted to "http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH" - swift_ilo_container - This will be defaulted to ironic_ilo_container - create_container_if_required - This will cause ilo driver to create the container if it doesn't exist. This will be defaulted to True. create() ^^^^^^^^ - Get a swift client with swift_util and user token - If swift_ilo_container doesn't exist and create_container_if_required is false, then error out. - Create the container if it doesn't exist - Create a new object in swift with the given meta-properties - Upload the file to swift in swift_ilo_container - Return the full swift object id get_swift_temp_url() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Part of the code to generate swift temp url is already under proposal. This code will refactor that code to generate swift_temp_url. TBD ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/fsimage.py ------------------------------------- This module will handle the creation of bootable linux iso images. When this module is provided with a linux kernel, ramdisk and command-line parameters to boot the kernel, this module provides the functionality to create isolinux bootable iso image to do so. This module has a class IsoLinuxImage with the following methods: create_image() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ - Create a temporary working directory. - Copy the kernel to the temporary working directory root /vmlinuz. - Copy the ramdisk to the temporary working directory root /initrd. - Concatenate the kernel command line parameters stored into a string (key1=val1 key2 key3=val3). - Generate a isolinux.cfg file from isolinux.cfg.template file replacing the kernel commandline parameters. - Create a directory in temporary working directory root /isolinux - Copy the isolinux.cfg file to the temporary working directory root isolinux/isolinux.cfg. - Copy the isolinux.bin file from /usr/lib/syslinux/isolinux.bin. - Run mkisofs with appropriate command-line arguments to generate the iso into the given output file. Deploy from baremetal node -------------------------- *NOTE*: This part of the deploy operation is in diskimage-builder and not in ironic. For this, refer the following design spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97736 Alternatives ------------ The iLO deploy driver could use the same vendorpassthru as PXE reference driver to get the image deployed from the conductor node using iSCSI. Deploying the image from baremetal node is better than deploying the image from the conductor node because * it doesn't hog the resources of the conductor node - it doesn't hog the I/O resources of the conductor node and doesn't consume separate thread for deployment. * it scales better than the current iSCSI solution. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ Changes need to made in nova to set the required driver_info for deploy and teardown. The following parameters should be added to the driver_info for spawn() call: * deploy_kernel * deploy_ramdisk * image id * size of root partition * size of swap partition * size of ephemeral partition * format of ephemeral partition Security impact --------------- * The user token is passed to the baremetal node through the management network via iLO virtual floppy media. The virtual floppy image consisting of the user token is built dynamically, uploaded to swift and then exposed to iLO over https. * The virtual floppy image is uploaded to a swift container with user token and is destroyed automatically by swift after the timeout. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ The solution is believed to scale better than the PXE reference implementation because it uses baremetal node's resources to do the image deployment. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- * The current input to the pxe deploy can be used by ilo deploy as well. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: rameshg87 Work Items ---------- The following are the work items: 1. Implement the IloDeploy module. 2. Implement the IloVendorInterface module. 3. Implement the changes to the reboot() method. 4. Implement the ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/swift.py module. 5. Implement the ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/fsimage.py module. Dependencies ============ This feature is dependant on the diskimage-builder change to add a new element to do the deployment from the baremetal node. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/97736 Uses hpproliant module: https://github.com/hpproliant/proliantutils Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== TBD References ========== TBD

revisions:

The __init__() method should always returns None, this patch fix a unexpected

Closes-Bug: 1353270

commit_message:
Fix unexpected return from Step::__init__()

The __init__() method should always returns None, this patch fix a unexpected
return statement with a TypeError exception, which should be corrected to a
raise statement.

Change-Id: I96d081ab23ac499d6151161d1ae59864c78ea44e
Closes-Bug: 1353270
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/00/112200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise TypeError("Connection handlers must be either " "callables or strings.")
deleted_lines: return TypeError("Connection handlers must be either " "callables or strings.")

commit_message:
Remove old DLO config remenents from proxy

Config items 'rate_limit_after_segment' and
'rate_limit_segments_per_sec' are configuration items left over from
before DLO was moved from the proxy server and into it's own
middleware. This change removes the configuration options from the
proxy server.

Change-Id: Ie3d42a57cda813feed019f01db986f13cdff9c31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/89/111889/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Swift configuration parameter audit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-04 06:14:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/329fd39ff46f7768dde4e7ef05426dc944bb3a3d', 'message': "Swift configuration parameter audit

NOTE:
  This is my first pass of the configuration audit. At this point
  in time I want people to look at it, but _not_ merge it yet. As
  I want people to look, I wont set it as WIP as that will mean
  reviewers will skip over it.

  This change is based of a comparison of the sample configurations
  and the swift code. After this, I will compare the documentation
  and update as required.

This change is the result of an audit through the config parameters
provided by swift and how/if they are addressed in the swift
documentation. The documentation being the sample config files in
the /etc directory or the documentation.

This change makes the following assumptions:
  - Unless stated otherwise, the commented out parameter in the
    sample configuration is the default for swift.

  - When the default in the code differs from that of the sample
    configuration, the default in the code is correct.

Container reconciler:
  Parameter: interval
    - code: 30
    - config: 300
  Result: config = 30

Object Expirer:
  Parameter: recon_cache_path
    - code: /var/cache/swift
    - config: Parameter missing
  Result: Add parameter

swift-dispersion-populate && swift-dispersion-report
  Parameter: auth_version
    - code: 1.0
    - config: 2.0
  Result: config = 1.0

swift-drive-audit:
  Parameter: log_file_pattern
    - code: /var/log/kern.*[!.][!g][!z]
    - config: /var/log/kern*
  Result: config = /var/log/kern.*[!.][!g][!z]

  NOTE: swift-drive-audit uses a parameter called device_dir which
        defaults to '/srv/node'. In all other swift binaries/services
        there is a similar parameter called devices which stores the
        same thing. This is an inconsistency which I haven't fixed
        as this could break existing swift clusters out in the wild.

Proxy Server:
  Parameter: object_chunk_size
    - code: 65536
    - config: 8192
  Result: config = 65536

  Parameter: client_chunk_size
    - code: 65536
    - config: 8192
  Result: config = 65536

  Parameter: rate_limit_segments_per_sec
    - code: 1
    - config: 0
  Result: config = 1
  NOTE: '0' means no rate limiting.

  Parameter: strict_cors_mode
    - code: True
    - config: No parameter
  Result: config = True

Account and Container replicator configuration confusion:
  NOTES:
    The account and container replicators have parameters:
      - interval
      - run_pause

    Both of these are loaded into the same variable in code:
      self.interval = int(conf.get('interval') or
                          conf.get('run_pause') or 30)

    If a user sets both to different values then interval is used.
  Result: Update the configuration to make this more clear.

Change-Id: Iaadbb1a6284f8b3e0801bc343b29772f70f4bf6e

commit_message:
Swift configuration parameter audit

This change is the result of an audit through the config parameters
provided by swift and how/if they are addressed in the swift
documentation. The documentation being the sample config files in
the /etc directory or the documentation.

This change is only concerned with the config files in etc/ next
I will look at the documentation in the doc/ folder.

This change makes the following assumptions:
  - Unless stated otherwise, the commented out parameter in the
    sample configuration is the default for swift.

  - When the default in the code differs from that of the sample
    configuration, the default in the code is correct.

Container reconciler:
  Parameter: interval
    - code: 30
    - config: 300
  Result: config = 30

Object Expirer:
  Parameter: recon_cache_path
    - code: /var/cache/swift
    - config: Parameter missing
  Result: Add parameter

swift-dispersion-populate && swift-dispersion-report
  Parameter: auth_version
    - code: 1.0
    - config: 2.0 (due to being a confusing example of how to setup
                   version 2.0).
  Result: Added 'auth_version = 1.0' to the right section (showing
          default and make the sample configuration for auth version
          2.0 easier to understand.

swift-drive-audit:
  Parameter: log_file_pattern
    - code: /var/log/kern.*[!.][!g][!z]
    - config: /var/log/kern*
  Result: config = /var/log/kern.*[!.][!g][!z]

  NOTE: swift-drive-audit uses a parameter called device_dir which
        defaults to '/srv/node'. In all other swift binaries/services
        there is a similar parameter called devices which stores the
        same thing. This is an inconsistency which I haven't fixed
        as this could break existing swift clusters out in the wild.

Proxy Server:
  Parameter: object_chunk_size
    - code: 65536
    - config: 8192
  Result: config = 65536

  Parameter: client_chunk_size
    - code: 65536
    - config: 8192
  Result: config = 65536

  Parameter: strict_cors_mode
    - code: True
    - config: No parameter
  Result: config = True

Account and Container replicator configuration confusion:
  NOTES:
    The account and container replicators have parameters:
      - interval
      - run_pause

    Both of these are loaded into the same variable in code:
      self.interval = int(conf.get('interval') or
                          conf.get('run_pause') or 30)

    If a user sets both to different values then interval is used.
  Result: Update the configuration to make this more clear.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iaadbb1a6284f8b3e0801bc343b29772f70f4bf6e

added_lines: # Note: if interval is defined then it is used in place of run_pause

commit_message:
Check for tardiff and add site to README.

When I rad milestone.sh the first time, one error I hit was that I
didn't have tardiff installed (and obviously didn't read the prereqs
in the README).  Note where you can find tardiff in the README and
also check for tardiff to be available as a sanity check before using
it.

Change-Id: Iafcbd173d3cd06af5873686c38af5aa3bd780e16

commit_message:
Install default-jre from devstack script

Currently, if you don't have java installed congress will fail to start
this patch fixes this by having devstack install the jre for us.

Change-Id: I9bb8bde6aa99fb22998c18b157e2793f93f2e7ee
closes-bug: 1353132
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/44/112144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # congress requires java so we install it here install_package default-jre

  Included client changes as another work item

Change-Id: I76a5e80288aed42d2b73839a2132f6c3e2cbb3dd
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-remove-uri-tenant-id
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/86/100386/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Remove the tenant-id from Barbican resource URIs ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-remove-uri-tenant-id OpenStack projects appear to be moving away from requiring a tenant-id in the URI, as this is redundant information when Keystone authentication is used. All Barbican resource URIs includes tenant_id as part of their URI. This need to be removed. Problem Description =================== All Barbican resources have a tenant-id in their URI. This helps to correlate the resource with the specified tenant when no external authentication mechanism is used. However, most Barbican deployments would use Keystone to authenticate the API requests. With Keystone, the tenant-id information is already obtained when the X-Auth-Token header from the request is validated. This makes the tenant-id in the URI redundant. Need a solution to remove the tenant-id from the URI. This solution should also be backwards compatible if the resource URI specifies the tenant-id. Proposed Change =============== All Barbican resource URIs will drop the tenant-id field from their URI: For example, /v1/<tenant-id>/secrets will become: /v1/secrets /v1/<tenant-id>/secrets/<secret-ref> will become: /v1/secrets/<secret-ref> and so on. * For all successfully authenticated client requests, the tenant-id (a.k.a keystone_id) would be obtained by looking up the authentication context associated with the request. If it is not found(unscoped token), the request will be denied with a HTTP 403 error. * If no authentication mechanism has been configured to use with the Barbican deployment, the client is expected to pass in a "X-Keystone-Id" request header, set to the desired tenant-id. Backwards compatability note: * Once the changes proposed by this spec are in place, callers of the API should no more specify the tenant-id in the uri. If tenant-id is specified, it would result in a HTTP 404 Not Found response. Responses Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- All Barbican REST resources will be impacted by this change. However, this change is limited to dropping the tenant-id from the uri. All other request parameters (including limit and filter parameters) will remain the same. API --- Secrets Create Secret: POST /v1/secrets Example:: Request: POST /v1/secrets { "name": "AES key", "expiration": "2014-02-28T19:14:44.180394", "algorithm": "aes", "bit_length": 256, "mode": "cbc", "payload": "gF6+lLoF3ohA9aPRpt+6bQ==", "payload_content_type": "application/octet-stream", "payload_content_encoding": "base64" } Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 201 Created { "secret_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/a8957047-16c6-4b05-ac57-8621edd0e9ee" } Two-step secret creation: PUT /v1/secrets/<secret-id> Example:: Request: PUT /v1/secrets/a8957047-16c6-4b05-ac57-8621edd0e9ee Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Header Content-Type:text/plain 'mysecret' Response: Status: 201 Created { "secret_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/a8957047-16c6-4b05-ac57-8621edd0e9ee" } List Secrets: GET /v1/secrets Example:: Request: GET /v1/secrets Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 200 Ok { "secrets": [ { "status": "ACTIVE", "updated": "2013-06-28T15:23:30.668641", "mode": "cbc", "name": "Main Encryption Key", "algorithm": "AES", "created": "2013-06-28T15:23:30.668619", "secret_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/e171bb2d-f14f-433e-84f0-3dfcac7a7311", "expiration": "2014-06-28T15:23:30.668619", "bit_length": 256, "content_types": { "default": "application/octet-stream" } }, { "updated": "2013-06-28T15:23:33.092660", "mode": null, "name": "PostgreSQL admin password", "algorithm": null, "created": "2013-06-28T15:23:33.092635", "secret_ref": Encryption Key", "algorithm": "AES", "secret_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/e171bb2d-f14f-433e-84f0-3dfcac7a7311", "expiration": "2014-06-28T15:23:30.668619", "bit_length": 256, "content_types": { "default": "application/octet-stream" } } Delete individual secret: DELETE /v1/secrets/<secret-id> Example:: Request: DELETE /v1/secrets/e171bb2d-f14f-433e-84f0-3dfcac7a7311 Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 204 No Content Create Secret(no authentication) : POST /v1/secrets Example:: Request: POST /v1/secrets { "name": "AES key", "expiration": "2014-02-28T19:14:44.180394", "algorithm": "aes", "bit_length": 256, "mode": "cbc", "payload": "gF6+lLoF3ohA9aPRpt+6bQ==", "payload_content_type": "application/octet-stream", "payload_content_encoding": "base64" } Header X-Keystone-Id:<tenant-id> Response: Status: 201 Created { "secret_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/a8957047-16c6-4b05-ac57-8621edd0e9ee" } Orders Create Order: POST /v1/orders Example:: Request: POST /v1/orders { "secret": { "name": "secretname", "algorithm": "AES", "bit_length": 256, "mode": "cbc", "payload_content_type": "application/octet-stream" } } Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 201 Created { "order_ref": "http://localhost:9311/v1/orders/a8957047-16c6-4b05-ac57-8621edd0e9ee" } Get individual order: GET /v1/orders/<order-id> Example:: Request: GET /v1/orders/f9b633d8-fda5-4be8-b42c-5b2c9280289e Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 200 Ok { "secret": { "name": "secretname", "algorithm": 'bogus' not supported." } Get list of orders per tenant: GET /v1/orders Example:: Request: GET /v1/orders Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 200 Ok { "orders": [ { "status": "ACTIVE", "secret_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/secrets/059805d5-b400-47da-abc5-cae7286d3ede", "name":"private_key_passphrase" }, { "name":"public_key" } ], "container_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers/888b29a4-c7cf-49d0-bfdf-bd9e6f26d718", "type":"rsa" } Get list of containers per tenant: GET /v1/containers Example:: Request: GET /v1/containers Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 200 Ok { "total":42, "containers":[ { "status":"ACTIVE", "updated":"2014-02-11T18:05:58.909411", "name":"generic container_updated", "secret_refs":[ { "secret_id":"123", "name":"private_key" }, { "secret_id":"321", "name":"public_key" }, { "secret_id":"456", "name":"private_key_passphrase" } ], "created":"2014-02-11T18:05:58.909403", "container_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers/d4e06015-4f6e-4626-ac3d-4ece6621f96d", "type":"rsa" }, { "status":"ACTIVE", "updated":"2014-02-11T18:08:58.160557", "name":"generic container_updated", "secret_refs":[ { "secret_id":"321", "name":"public_key" }, { "secret_id":"456", "name":"private_key_passphrase" } ], "created":"2014-02-11T18:08:58.160551", "container_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers/bb24fa61-0b5f-4d40-8990-846e95cd7b12", "type":"rsa" }, { "status":"ACTIVE", "updated":"2014-02-11T18:25:58.198072", "name":"generic container_updated", "secret_refs":[ { "secret_id":"1df433d6-c2d4-480d-90fb-0bfd9c5da3dd", "name":"private_key" }, { "secret_id":"321", "name":"public_key" }, { "secret_id":"456", "name":"private_key_passphrase" } ], "created":"2014-02-11T18:25:58.198063", "container_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers/38f58696-5013-4bd6-ab2b-fbea41dc957a", "type":"rsa" }, { "status":"ACTIVE", "updated":"2014-02-11T18:44:06.296957", "name":"generic container_updated", "secret_refs":[ { "secret_id":"1df433d6-c2d4-480d-90fb-0bfd9c5da3dd", "name":"private_key" }, { "secret_id":"321", "name":"public_key" }, { "secret_id":"456", "name":"private_key_passphrase" } ], "created":"2014-02-11T18:44:06.296947", "container_ref":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers/a8d1adfd-0d36-4eb0-8762-99787eb4a7ff", "type":"rsa" } ], "next":"http://localhost:9311/v1/containers?limit=10&offset=10" } Delete individual container: DELETE /v1/containers/<container-id> Example:: Request: DELETE /v1/containers/e171bb2d-f14f-433e-84f0-3dfcac7a7311 Header X-Auth-Token:<token> Response: Status: 204 No Content Security impact --------------- * This API change need keystone token which will be used for authorization. * Requests without the token will be considered as unauthenticated requests. Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- * Barbican python client will need to be enhanced to accommodate API changes. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Venkat Sundaram (tsv) will implement this change. Work Items ---------- * Enhance the PecanAPI routing mechanism to check/parse tenant-id and "X-Keystone-Id" header in a backwards compatible manner. (tsv - IN_PROGRESS) * Enhance the enforce_rback decorator for the controllers to get the keystone_id from the authentication context if it is not passed in(tsv - IN_PROGRESS) * Update the barbican/common/util module method hostname_for_refs to strip tenant-id from the URI links returned in response body (tsv - IN_PROGRESS) * Enhance the tests Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Update unit tests to drop tenant-id from uri. * Tempest tests need to be added for functional testing Documentation Impact ==================== * Existing documentation has to be updated to remove the tenant-id from the uri. * Explain how to specify tenant-id when no authentication mechanism is used. References ========== - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/api-remove-uri-tenant-id

commit_message:
Update oslo.rootwrap to 1.3.0.0a1

oslo.config 1.3.0.0a1 has the ChainingRegExpFilter which Cinder will
adopt to allow 'cgexec' and 'ionice' commands.

commit_message:
Add test skip decorator when service not available

Adding services_required decorator that can be used for decorating test classes
as well as test methods. Decorator expects as arguments services that
should be available during test execution.

Skipping decorators are not available in the nose python library,
therefore custom skipping decorator has to be made.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I6de4ec75ef9dc56f1ed11057d8b30bb0a782c6e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/96/110896/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support external DHCP providers

This spec adds support for external DHCP providers to remove a hard
dependency on Neutron's DHCP server.

Change-Id: I1d27ad099a34dcf25e649925ba42ad3084a2b65e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/96/102296/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Support external DHCP providers =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/support-external-dhcp Ironic should allow operators to use an external DHCP server, rather than Neutron's DHCP server. Problem description =================== There are a number of reasons a deployer may wish to use an external DHCP server. These include: * Neutron is not available in the deployer's environment. * The deployer may believe Neutron's DHCP server is not scalable. Neutron's DHCP server uses dnsmasq under the hood, which is known to be unsuitable for large-scale deployments (see links in references section). * Other DHCP servers may provide features that Neutron does not support. For example, Neutron does not support iPXE today (TODO: need source for this besides "I think Lucas said something like this"). Proposed change =============== Ironic should have a configuration option `dhcp_provider` that accepts two values: "neutron" or "external". (TODO: should this be driver-specific?) When "neutron" is used for this configuration option, Ironic will operate using Neutron's DHCP server, as it does today. When "external" is used for this option, code that interacts with Neutron to configure DHCP will not run. (TODO: how to handle PXE configuration for multiple deploy ramdisks? Will this only support a single deploy ramdisk?) (TODO: how to handle PXE booting instances? Will boot from disk be required?) Alternatives ------------ Alternatives do not exist for deployers that do not wish to run Neutron in their environment. An alternative for deployers that believe dnsmasq does not scale well enough for their environments, is to contribute to Neutron and add another DHCP provider that is not dnsmasq. An alternative for deployers that need advanced features not supported by Neutron, is to contribute those features to Neutron or Neutron's DHCP provider. Contributing to Neutron is not viable for all deployers, and could take a long time to do, delaying someone's Ironic deployment in the meantime. Data model impact ----------------- None as planned today, however something may pop up while deciding how to handle multiple deploy ramdisks or PXE boots of instance images. REST API impact --------------- None as planned today, however something may pop up while deciding how to handle multiple deploy ramdisks or PXE boots of instance images. Driver API impact ----------------- None as planned today, however something may pop up while deciding how to handle multiple deploy ramdisks or PXE boots of instance images. Nova driver impact ------------------ None as planned today, however something may pop up while deciding how to handle multiple deploy ramdisks or PXE boots of instance images. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ This will only make Ironic more scalable, as it will expose a configuration in which Ironic no longer interacts with Neutron. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- A config option `dhcp_provider` will be added that has two options, "neutron" and "external". There will be no immediate impact on deployers, as `dhcp_provider` will default to "neutron", which does not change behavior. However, deployers that wish to use an external DHCP provider must set the config option and also deploy a DHCP service. Developer impact ---------------- Developers will need to implement support for this option in their deploy drivers. (TODO: is this true, or should implementation be optional? Making it optional may make transition easier, as well as deciding how to support multiple ramdisks. My initial thought, though, is to require support.) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jroll Other contributors: JoshNang Work Items ---------- * Add `dhcp_provider` config option. * Implement changes in drivers. * Add Tempest tests Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Tempest tests should be written that use an external DHCP provider. dnsmasq is already installed in devstack, so this could be accomplished by running dnsmasq standalone, rather than via Neutron. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation will need to be written for this config option. This should include: * What the config option does. * How to configure an external DHCP server to work with Ironic. * A diagram of what the control plane looks like for both dhcp_provider options. References ========== * "Dnsmasq provides network infrastructure for small networks": http://www.thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/doc.html

commit_message:
Remove extra config block

This config block is entirely redundant and is actually causing an error
with the cinder passthrough config support. An extra "[]" is added to
the bottom of /etc/cinder/cinder.conf from the passthrough support
causing the following error from cinder-volume:

oslo.config.cfg.ConfigFileParseError: Failed to parse /etc/cinder/cinder.conf:
at /etc/cinder/cinder.conf:34, Empty section name: '[]'

Change-Id: Id9089b2fa37b8abd2f9d83087736e7fb7305210d

commit_message:
Cinder: allow customization of the iscsi helper

Updates devtest_overcloud.sh so that we can customize
the Cinder iscsi_helper option. The default is still
tgtadm.

This is important because it allows users of LIO to
automatically set their default iscsi_helper to
lioadm when using devtest. LIO is the preferred
default on Fedora and RHEL.

Change-Id: I9860f6b57a2f6632119ae2a23d997d12a767d0dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/65/106465/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## #. Customize the Cinder iscsi helper. ## If you are using LIO set this to lioadm. Defaults to tgtadm. OVERCLOUD_CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER=${OVERCLOUD_CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER=:-'tgtadm'} "CinderISCSIHelper": "'"${OVERCLOUD_CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER}"'",

commit_message:
Handle FloatingIpPoolNotFound exception in floating ip creation

If an invalid pool is specified when creating a floating ip
with neutron as the backend a FloatingIpPoolNotFound exception
can be raised. This change handles the exception at the API level.

Change-Id: Iac46d86a11f2c1da0ed7e7861cdb87fd4d4b4c6c
Closes-Bug: 1352141
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/111648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.FloatingIpPoolNotFound as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=e.format_message())

commit_message:
Allow keepalived to load kernel modules

Toggle a SElinux boolean to allow keepalived to load kernel modules
when SELinux is in enforcing mode.

Closes-Bug: 1342872
Change-Id: I8b53ade65426c132e4200e0cbd6800ee9e59f00f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/48/107448/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Allow keepalived to load kernel modules # Bug 1342872 if [[ -x /usr/sbin/semanage ]]; then setsebool -P domain_kernel_load_modules 1 fi

commit_message:
Add method for deallocating networks on reschedule

The original call to dhcp_options_for_instance() is not a great way to
check whether deallocation of networks should happen on reschedules.

This adds a new virt driver method 'deallocate_networks_on_reschedule'
which can be used by a virt driver to say whether reschedules should
deallocate networks first. This defaults to False and modifies the
baremetal virt driver to return True. Ironic virt driver will also need
to return True.

Closes-Bug: 1342919
Change-Id: I54a3252ab15e2d8b596ccc90eb4755405021f1da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/108640/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: old_node = instance['node'] instance['node'] = node try: if self.driver.macs_for_instance(instance): self._cleanup_allocated_networks(context, instance, requested_networks) finally: instance['node'] = old_node

commit_message:
Enable haproxy_connect_any port access

Enable a boolean to allow haproxy to proxy any port. If not set,
SELinux, in enforcing mode, denies haproxy access and haproxy will
fail to start.

Closes-Bug: 1339938
Change-Id: Ic7980285d2aa678315d73295226508fcf2de40f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/34/107234/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Allow haproxy to proxy any port if SELinux is in enforcing mode if [[ -x /usr/sbin/semanage ]]; then setsebool -P haproxy_connect_any 1 fi

commit_message:
Fixed DeprecationWarning in exc_filters

DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
This warning was generated in exc_filters during exception conversions.
Fix it by removing access to deprecated attribute

Closes-Bug: #1257530

Change-Id: I8ff8b974946ecab13f12a70b315dd94c3453197e

commit_message:
Add network_device_mtu value to dnsmasq options file

Despite network_device_mtu option can be specified in
neutron.conf, its value is not applied to VMs.
Adding it to dnsmasq options file will force
dhcp server to pass the mtu value to VMs.

Also added a unit test.

Closes-Bug: 1348788
Change-Id: I8d673134746f13585b2672866a5feb6e254f93ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/111748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.conf.network_device_mtu: options.append('option:mtu,%s' % self.conf.network_device_mtu)

commit_message:
Increase deployment_check timeout in murano tests

Current timeout on deploy_check action in murano tests
is not enough for fuel system tests on CentOS

Change-Id: I293386c8933022e9413a3652c9dc3235f8c4e630
Closes-bug: #1353454

Add a section to the spec template for testing

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/12/112112/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Testing Impact -------------- Please discuss how the change will be tested. It is assumed that unit test coverage will be added so that doesn't need to be mentioned explicitly, but if you think unit tests are sufficient and we don't need to add more integration tests, please explain here. If we do need integration tests, especially if the change introduces a dependency on a service or new library for which we might need to support multiple versions, describe the testing strategy. Is this untestable in gate given current limitations (specific hardware / software configurations available)? If so, are there mitigation plans (3rd party testing, gate enhancements, etc).

commit_message:
Use my_ip for neutron URL

Currently, neutron URL is set 127.0.0.1 in ironic.conf.
This patch fix this using $my_ip same as other component's URL
(for example glance).

Change-Id: I558fccc74058fcc493cbf52799fe021b12518253
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/38/104738/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

' 'Set to https for SSL.'), neutron_url = '%s://%s:%s' % (CONF.neutron.neutron_protocol, CONF.neutron.neutron_host, CONF.neutron.neutron_port) params['endpoint_url'] = neutron_url params['endpoint_url'] = (neutron_url or params['endpoint_url'] = neutron_url

commit_message:
Change packages to monasca.thresh

The diffs are going to be very hard to read on this change, but
basically the change is from com.hpcloud.mon to monasca.thresh.

Since monasca-common packages haven't changed, yet, they are still
referenced as com.hpcloud.mon, but everything else has changed to
monasca.thresh.

The init script has also been changed to invoke the new package path.

Change-Id: I5aad9302a8f5b11ed1b9874160f0d7a9882c5b2d

commit_message:
Extracting make_resource_metadata method

Dividing this method into multiple helps to reuse it in
some tools scripts for generating data.

Change-Id: I45230cd43d82e946fab394c4b6a1fe6b64cd8937
Related-Bug: #1349791

commit_message:
Fix make_test_data tools script

Method get_connection has been renamed to
get_connection_from_config.

Resource is object not dictionary, so attributes needs to be
accessed that way.

Change-Id: I19e09f3e9077d3346b4361fa6975a3e696e2e765
Related-Bug: #1349791

commit_message:
NSX: remove req_timeout as it's not longer used

This patch removes req_timeout from devstack as it's no longer used.
This was removed from neutron here:
    Id7244cd4d9316931f4f7df1c3b41b3a894f2909a

Change-Id: Ife901479605323e32f24e11266a232fddbd6bdca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/17/112117/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if [[ "$NSX_REQ_TIMEOUT" != "" ]]; then iniset /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE DEFAULT req_timeout $NSX_REQ_TIMEOUT fi

commit_message:
Use CentOS cmd while syncing time on bootstrap

If node in bootstrap mode we should use 'ntpd' as
daemon name wile synchronizing time, even if Ubuntu
is selected as OS, because bootstrap image is based
on CentOS.

Change-Id: I182c2796de5c5bed8e4b3fe67f63125f5e10c57f
Closes-bug: #1353455

commit_message:
Use CentOS cmd while syncing time on bootstrap

If node in bootstrap mode we should use 'ntpd' as
daemon name wile synchronizing time, even if Ubuntu
is selected as OS, because bootsrap image is based
on CentOS.

Change-Id: Ic2e86306844709b1794f94e3612306384a2aaaa9
Closes-bug: #1353455

commit_message:
List federated projects and domains

Add calls for utilizing ``/OS-FEDERATION/projects`` and
``/OS-FEDERATION/domains``.

Change-Id: I670c1f284c1980e2258881caf51801ea66645c4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/93/107393/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from keystoneclient import base from keystoneclient.v3 import projects class _EntitiesManager(base.Manager): """Manager class for listing federated accessible objects.""" resource_class = projects.Project object_type = None def list(self): url = '/OS-FEDERATION/%s' % self.object_type return super(Entities, self)._list(url, self.object_type) class ProjectManager(_EntitiesManager): object_type = 'projects' class DomainManager(_EntitiesManager): object_type = 'domains'

commit_message:
first pass of integrating javelin2 to grenade

This provides support for creating users, images, servers, and
objects and checking on the far side.

Depends-On: If5f2674179eea4972ad43a1581073d483bb75d79 from
tempest to fix some javelin issues to make it usable.

Change-Id: I3634fd1c1db08a9a03e2dce56ebe5424fe2f27d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/17/97317/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is a yaml description for the most basic definitions # of what should exist across the resource boundary. Perhaps # one day this will grow into a Heat resource template, but as # Heat isn't a known working element in the upgrades, we do # this much simpler thing for now. tenants: - javelin - discuss users: - name: javelin pass: gungnir tenant: javelin - name: javelin2 pass: gungnir2 tenant: discuss secgroups: - angon: owner: javelin rules: - 'icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0' - 'tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0' # resources that we want to create images: - name: javelin_cirros owner: javelin file: cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-blank.img format: ami aki: cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-vmlinuz ari: cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-initrd volumes: - assegai: - owner: javelin - gb: 1 servers: - name: peltast owner: javelin flavor: m1.small image: javelin_cirros - name: hoplite owner: javelin flavor: m1.medium image: javelin_cirros objects: - container: jc1 name: javelin1 owner: javelin file: /etc/hosts

subject: Only upgrade services we are actually running
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-23 21:13:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/grenade/commit/86b95045f86bb53637e08b9a4d25632bd9354ff6', 'message': "Make grenade work outside of the gate

Only upgrade the services that are actually active in grenade,
making it runnable outside of the gate environment where ceilometer
isn't enabled.

Ensure the /opt/stack directory can be built and owned by the stack
user.

Wait long enough for nova-compute to shut down, because otherwise
we'll often die there.

commit_message:
Only upgrade services we are actually running

Only upgrade the services that are actually active in grenade,
making it runnable outside of the gate environment where ceilometer
isn't enabled.

Change-Id: I3aeff82ceb99fbfa3689141f0dae974189c7370a

commit_message:
Fix issue with snapshot name on error

In patching tests, when error happens
identical snapshot names was used in case
of error, so we can not revert all errored envs.

Change-Id: I0d8bde7989f4bacaec728759b060bd53f9f17cf7

Revert environment 2. Upload tarball 3. Check that it uploaded 4. Extract data 5. Get available releases 6. Run update script 7. Check that new release appears 8. Put new release into cluster 9. Run rollback 4. Check that rollback was successful 5. Run OSTF 6. Create snapshot """

commit_message:
make grenade logdir creation work on clean system

On a completely fresh system, /opt/stack is something which doesn't
yet exist, and the directory creation for it will fail on the first
try. By reordering the directory creation it will be easier for
people to get this working with completely fresh systems.

Change-Id: I5183ce091d0c3d417e700aa2c8b932507e51c16a

added_lines: log_error $LINENO "missing $TOP_DIR/stackrc - did you grab more than just stack.sh?" log_error $LINENO "missing devstack/files" log_error $LINENO "missing devstack/lib" echo "FATAL: Use the actual swift service names to enable tham as required:"# The Debian Wheezy official repositories do not contain all required packages, # add gplhost repository. if [[ "$os_VENDOR" =~ (Debian) ]]; then echo 'deb http://archive.gplhost.com/debian grizzly main' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gplhost_wheezy-backports.list echo 'deb http://archive.gplhost.com/debian grizzly-backports main' | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gplhost_wheezy-backports.list apt_get update apt_get install --force-yes gplhost-archive-keyring fi # Allow the use of an alternate protocol (such as https) for service endpoints SERVICE_PROTOCOL=${SERVICE_PROTOCOL:-http} source $TOP_DIR/lib/congress $TOP_DIR/tools/install_pip.sh# Do the ugly hacks for borken packages and distros #configure_ceilometerclientif is_service_enabled congress; then install_congressclient install_congress echo_summary "Configuring Congress" configure_congress #configure_congressclient fi if is_service_enabled congress; then create_congress_accounts fiif is_service_enabled ceilometer; then echo_summary "Starting Congress" init_congress start_congress fi # TODO(dtroyer): Remove EXTRA_OPTS after stable/icehouse branch is cut # Specific warning for deprecated configs if [[ -n "$EXTRA_OPTS" ]]; then echo "" echo_summary "WARNING: EXTRA_OPTS is used" echo "You are using EXTRA_OPTS to pass configuration into nova.conf." echo "Please convert that configuration in localrc to a nova.conf section in local.conf:" echo "EXTRA_OPTS will be removed early in the Juno development cycle" echo " [[post-config|\$NOVA_CONF]] [DEFAULT] " for I in "${EXTRA_OPTS[@]}"; do # Replace the first '=' with ' ' for iniset syntax echo ${I} done fi # TODO(dtroyer): Remove EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS after stable/icehouse branch is cut if [[ -n "$EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS" ]]; then echo "" echo_summary "WARNING: EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS is used" echo "You are using EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS to pass configuration into nova.conf." echo "Please convert that configuration in localrc to a nova.conf section in local.conf:" echo "EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS will be removed early in the Juno development cycle" echo " [[post-config|\$NOVA_CONF]] [baremetal] " for I in "${EXTRA_BAREMETAL_OPTS[@]}"; do # Replace the first '=' with ' ' for iniset syntax echo ${I} done fi # TODO(dtroyer): Remove Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS after stable/icehouse branch is cut if [[ -n "$Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS" ]]; then echo_summary "WARNING: Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS is used" echo "You are using Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS to pass configuration into $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE." echo "Please convert that configuration in localrc to a $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE section in local.conf:" echo "Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS will be removed early in the Juno development cycle"[[post-config|/\$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]] [DEFAULT] for I in "${Q_DHCP_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS[@]}"; do # Replace the first '=' with ' ' for iniset syntax echo ${I} done fi # TODO(dtroyer): Remove Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS after stable/icehouse branch is cut if [[ -n "$Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS" ]]; then echo "" echo_summary "WARNING: Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS is used" echo "You are using Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS to pass configuration into $NEUTRON_CONF." echo "Please convert that configuration in localrc to a $NEUTRON_CONF section in local.conf:" echo "Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS will be removed early in the Juno development cycle" echo " [[post-config|\$NEUTRON_CONF]] [DEFAULT] " for I in "${Q_SRV_EXTRA_DEFAULT_OPTS[@]}"; do # Replace the first '=' with ' ' for iniset syntax echo ${I} done

added_lines: from nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.models.base import Base def get_object_or_404(self, obj, *args, **kwargs): # TODO(enchantner): remove this hack after switching to objects if issubclass(obj, Base): return self._get_model_or_404(obj, *args, **kwargs) log_404 = kwargs.pop("log_404") if "log_404" in kwargs else None log_get = kwargs.pop("log_get") if "log_get" in kwargs else None if "id" in kwargs: exist = obj.get_by_uid(kwargs["id"]) elif len(args) > 0: exist = obj.get_by_uid(args[0]) if not exist: if log_404: getattr(logger, log_404[0])(log_404[1]) raise self.http(404, u'{0} not found'.format(obj.__name__)) else: if log_get: getattr(logger, log_get[0])(log_get[1]) return exist def _get_model_or_404(self, model, *args, **kwargs): """DEPRECATED. Temporary helper for searching instance by it's SQLAlchemy instance and not object. Will be removed in the future. """ raise self.http(404, u'{0} not found'.format(model.__name__)) def get_objects_list_or_404(self, obj, ids): # TODO(enchantner): remove this hack after switching to objects if issubclass(obj, Base): return self._get_model_list_or_404(obj, ids) node_query = obj.filter_by_id_list(None, ids) objects_count = obj.count(node_query) if len(set(ids)) != objects_count: raise self.http(404, '{0} not found'.format(obj.__name__)) return node_query def _get_model_list_or_404(self, model, ids): """DEPRECATED. commit_message:
Make swift-form-signature output a sample form

swift-form-signature would give you the required expiration-time and
HMAC signature, but it wouldn't help you actually construct the HTML
form. To do that, you had to go look at the formpost middleware's doc
string and make up a form yourself.

For convenience, this commit makes swift-form-signature output a
sample form with the computed values filled in already; the user only
needs to fill in the Swift cluster's hostname.

Change-Id: I70d70a648b78b382dbfbe8ff918e6158a7f6a0ab

commit_message:
Make swift-form-signature testable

Moved the body of bin/swift-form-signature into
swift/cli/form_signature.py, like was done with swift-ring-builder and
others. Added a couple basic tests; there's not 100% coverage, but
it's better than the 0% coverage we had before.

It's almost a straight forklift, but I changed exit() calls to return
statements.

Change-Id: Ie2f702c070da24d9cdface83b9e838e9e2965085
