./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:808(para) msgid "Enter a device name under which the volume should be accessible on the virtual machine." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:812(para) msgid "Click Attach Volume to confirm your changes. The dashboard shows the instance to which the volume has been attached and the volume's device name." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:817(para) msgid "Now you can log in to the instance, mount the disk, format it, and use it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:821(para) msgid "To detach a volume from an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:824(para) msgid "Select the volume and click Edit Attachments." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:827(para) msgid "Click Detach Volume and confirm your changes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:834(guilabel) msgid "OpenStack command-line clients" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:836(para) msgid "You can use the OpenStack command-line clients to run simple commands that make API calls and automate tasks by using scripts. Internally, each client command runs cURL commands that embed API requests. The OpenStack APIs are RESTful APIs that use the HTTP protocol, including methods, URIs, media types, and response codes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:842(para) msgid "These open-source Python clients run on Linux or Mac OS X systems and are easy to learn and use. Each OpenStack service has its own command-line client. On some client commands, you can specify a debug parameter to show the underlying API request for the command. This is a good way to become familiar with the OpenStack API calls." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:848(para) msgid "The following command-line clients are available for the respective services' APIs:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:850(para) msgid "cinder(python-cinderclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:851(para) msgid "Client for the Block Storage service API. Use to create and manage volumes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:853(para) msgid "glance(python-glanceclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:854(para) msgid "Client for the Image Service API. Use to create and manage images." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:856(para) msgid "keystone(python-keystoneclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:857(para) msgid "Client for the Identity Service API. Use to create and manage users, tenants, roles, endpoints, and credentials." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:860(para) msgid "nova(python-novaclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:861(para) msgid "Client for the Compute API and its extensions. Use to create and manage images, instances, and flavors." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:863(para) msgid "neutron(python-neutronclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:864(para) msgid "Client for the Networking API. Use to configure networks for guest servers. This client was previously known as neutron." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:867(para) msgid "swift(python-swiftclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:868(para) msgid "Client for the Object Storage API. Use to gather statistics, list items, update metadata, upload, download and delete files stored by the object storage service. Provides access to a swift installation for ad hoc processing." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:872(para) msgid "heat(python-heatclient)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:873(para) msgid "Client for the Orchestration API. Use to launch stacks from templates, view details of running stacks including events and resources, and update and delete stacks." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:876(guilabel) msgid "Install the OpenStack command-line clients" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:877(para) msgid "To install the clients, install the prerequisite software and the Python package for each OpenStack client." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:879(guilabel) msgid "Install the clients" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:880(para) msgid "Use pipto install the OpenStack clients on a Mac OS X or Linux system. It is easy and ensures that you get the latest version of the client from the<link href=\"http://pypi.python.org/pypi\"/><link href=\"http://pypi.python.org/pypi\">Python Package Index</link>. Also, piplets you update or remove a package. After you install the clients, you must source an openrc file to set required environment variables before you can request OpenStack services through the clients or the APIs." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:890(para) msgid "To install the clients" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:893(para) msgid "You must install each client separately." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:896(para) msgid "Run the following command to install or update a client package:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:899(para) msgid "Where <project> is the project name and has one of the following values:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:903(para) msgid "nova. Compute API and extensions." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:906(para) msgid "neutron. Networking API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:909(para) msgid "keystone. Identity Service API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:912(para) msgid "glance. Image Service API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:915(para) msgid "swift. Object Storage API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:918(para) msgid "cinder. Block Storage service API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:921(para) msgid "heat. Orchestration API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:926(para) msgid "For example, to install the nova client, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:931(para) msgid "To update the nova client, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:936(para) msgid "To remove the nova client, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:941(para) msgid "Before you can issue client commands, you must download and source the openrc file to set environment variables. Proceed to<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/cli_openrc.html\">the section called “OpenStack RC file”</link>." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:948(guilabel) msgid "Get the version for a client" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:949(para) msgid "After you install an OpenStack client, you can search for its version number, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:951(para) msgid "$ pip freeze | grep python-" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:952(para) msgid "python-glanceclient==0.4.0python-keystoneclient==0.1.2-e git+https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient.git@077cc0bf22e378c4c4b970f2331a695e440a939f#egg=python_novaclient-devpython-neutronclient==0.1.1python-swiftclient==1.1.1" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:954(para) msgid "You can also use the yolk -lcommand to see which version of the client is installed:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:956(para) msgid "$ yolk -l | grep python-novaclient" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:957(para) msgid "python-novaclient - 2.6.10.27 - active development (/Users/your.name/src/cloud-servers/src/src/python-novaclient)python-novaclient - 2012.1 - non-active" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:960(guilabel) msgid "OpenStack RC file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:961(para) msgid "To set the required environment variables for the OpenStack command-line clients, you must download and source an environment file, openrc.sh. It is project-specific and contains the credentials used by OpenStack Compute, Image, and Identity services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:966(para) msgid "When you source the file and enter the password, environment variables are set for that shell. They allow the commands to communicate to the OpenStack services that run in the cloud." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:970(para) msgid "You can download the file from the OpenStack dashboard as an administrative user or any other user." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:972(para) msgid "To download the OpenStack RC file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:978(para) msgid "On the Project tab, select the project for which you want to download the OpenStack RC file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:982(para) msgid "Click Access & Security. Then, click Download OpenStack RC File and save the file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:986(para) msgid "Copy the openrc.sh file to the machine from where you want to run OpenStack commands." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:990(para) msgid "For example, copy the file to the machine from where you want to upload an image with a glance client command." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:994(para) msgid "On any shell from where you want to run OpenStack commands, source the openrc.sh file for the respective project." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:999(para) msgid "In this example, we source the demo-openrc.sh file for the demo project:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1003(para) msgid "$ source demo-openrc.sh" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1006(para) msgid "When you are prompted for an OpenStack password, enter the OpenStack password for the user who downloaded the openrc.sh file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1011(para) msgid "When you run OpenStack client commands, you can override some environment variable settings by using the options that are listed at the end of the nova help output. For example, you can override the OS_PASSWORD setting in the openrc.sh file by specifying a password on a nova command, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1019(para) msgid "$ nova --password <password> image-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1022(para) msgid "Where password is your password." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1026(para) msgid "During setup of OpenStack cloud, the cloud operator sets user permissions to manage images." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1028(para) msgid "Image upload and management might be restricted to only cloud administrators or cloud operators." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1030(para) msgid "After you upload an image, it is considered golden and you cannot change it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1032(para) msgid "You can upload images through the glance client or the Image Service API. You can also use the nova client to list images, set and delete image metadata, delete images, and take a snapshot of a running instance to create an image." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1036(guilabel) msgid "Manage images with the glance client" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1037(para) msgid "To list or get details for images" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1040(para) msgid "To list the available images:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1043(para) msgid "$ glance image-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1046(para) msgid "You can use grep to filter the list, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1050(para) msgid "$ glance image-list | grep 'cirros'" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1053(para) msgid "To get image details, by name or ID:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1056(para) msgid "$ glance image-show myCirrosImage" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1059(para) msgid "To add an image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1062(para) msgid "The following example uploads a CentOS 6.3 image in qcow2 format and con../figures it for public access:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1066(para) msgid "$glance image-create --name centos63-image --disk-format=qcow2 --container-format=bare --is-public=True ./centos63.qcow2" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1071(para) msgid "To create an image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1074(para) msgid "Write any buffered data to disk." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1077(para) msgid "For more information, see the<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-ops/content/snapsnots.html\">Taking Snapshots</link> in the OpenStack Operations Guide." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1083(para) msgid "To create the image, list instances to get the server ID:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1087(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1635(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1791(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1954(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2104(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2121(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2277(para) msgid "$ nova list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1090(para) msgid "In this example, the server is named myCirrosServer. Use this server to create a snapshot, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1094(para) msgid "$ nova image-create myCirrosServer myCirrosImage" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1098(para) msgid "The command creates a qemu snapshot and automatically uploads the image to your repository. Only the tenant that creates the image has access to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1103(para) msgid "Get details for your image to check its status:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1106(para) msgid "$ nova image-show IMAGE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1109(para) msgid "The image status changes from SAVING to ACTIVE. Only the tenant who creates the image has access to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1113(para) msgid "To launch an instance from your image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1116(para) msgid "To launch an instance from your image, include the image ID and flavor ID, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1120(para) msgid "$ nova boot newServer --image 7e5142af-1253-4634-bcc6-89482c5f2e8a --flavor 3" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1124(guilabel) msgid "Troubleshoot image creation" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1127(para) msgid "You cannot create a snapshot from an instance that has an attached volume. Detach the volume, create the image, and re-mount the volume." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1132(para) msgid "Make sure the version of qemu you are using is version 0.14 or greater. Older versions of qemu result in an \"unknown option -s\" error message in the nova-compute.log." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1138(para) msgid "Examine the /var/log/nova-api.log and /var/log/nova-compute.log log files for error messages." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1143(guilabel) msgid "Set up access and security for instances" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1144(para) msgid "When you launch a virtual machine, you can inject a key pair, which provides SSH access to your instance. For this to work, the image must contain the cloud-init package. Create at least one key pair for each project. If you generate a keypair with an external tool, you can import it into OpenStack. You can use the key pair for multiple instances that belong to that project. In case an image uses a static root password or a static key set – neither is recommended – you must not provide a key pair when you launch the instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1153(para) msgid "A security group is a named collection of network access rules that you use to limit the types of traffic that have access to instances. When you launch an instance, you can assign one or more security groups to it. If you do not create security groups, new instances are automatically assigned to the default security group, unless you explicitly specify a different security group. The associated rules in each security group control the traffic to instances in the group. Any incoming traffic that is not matched by a rule is denied access by default. You can add rules to or remove rules from a security group. You can modify rules for the default and any other security group." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1165(para) msgid "You must modify the rules for the default security group because users cannot access instances that use the default group from any IP address outside the cloud." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1168(para) msgid "You can modify the rules in a security group to allow access to instances through different ports and protocols. For example, you can modify rules to allow access to instances through SSH, to ping them, or to allow UDP traffic – for example, for a DNS server running on an instance. You specify the following parameters for rules:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1176(para) msgid "Source of traffic. Enable traffic to instances from either IP addresses inside the cloud from other group members or from all IP addresses." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1181(para) msgid "Protocol. Choose TCP for SSH, ICMP for pings, or UDP." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1185(para) msgid "Destination port on virtual machine. Defines a port range. To open a single port only, enter the same value twice. ICMP does not support ports: Enter values to define the codes and types of ICMP traffic to be allowed." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1191(para) msgid "Rules are automatically enforced as soon as you create or modify them." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1193(para) msgid "You can also assign a floating IP address to a running instance to make it accessible from outside the cloud. You assign a floating IP address to an instance and attach a block storage device, or volume, for persistent storage." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1197(guilabel) msgid "Add or import keypairs" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1198(para) msgid "To add a key" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1199(para) msgid "You can generate a keypair or upload an existing public key." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1203(para) msgid "To generate a keypair, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1207(para) msgid "$ nova keypair-add KEY_NAME > MY_KEY.pem" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1210(para) msgid "The command generates a keypair named KEY_NAME, writes the private key to the MY_KEY.pem file, and registers the public key at the Nova database." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1215(para) msgid "To set the permissions of the MY_KEY.pem file, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1219(para) msgid "$ chmod 600 MY_KEY.pem" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1222(para) msgid "The command changes the permissions of the MY_KEY.pem file so that only you can read and write to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1226(para) msgid "To import a key" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1229(para) msgid "If you have already generated a keypair with the public key located at ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub, run the following command to upload the public key:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1234(para) msgid "$ nova keypair-add --pub_key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub KEY_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1238(para) msgid "The command registers the public key at the Nova database and names the keypair KEY_NAME." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1242(para) msgid "List keypairs to make sure that the uploaded keypair appears in the list:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1264(para) msgid "To create a security group" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1267(para) msgid "To create a security group with a specified name and description, enter the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1275(para) msgid "To delete a security group" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1278(para) msgid "To delete a specified group, enter the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1282(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-delete SEC_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1285(para) msgid "To configure security group rules" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1286(para) msgid "Modify security group rules with the nova secgroup-*-rulecommands." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1290(para) msgid "On a shell, source the OpenStack RC file. For details, see<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/cli_openrc.html\"/><link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/cli_openrc.html\">the section called “OpenStack RC file”</link>." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1298(para) msgid "To list the rules for a security group" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1301(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-list-rules SEC_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1304(para) msgid "To allow SSH access to the instances" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1307(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1343(para) msgid "Choose one of the following sub-steps:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1312(para) msgid "Add rule for all IPs" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1315(para) msgid "Either from all IP addresses (specified as IP subnet in CIDR notation as 0.0.0.0/0):" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1319(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-rule SEC_GROUP_NAME tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1325(para) msgid "Add rule for security groups" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1328(para) msgid "Alternatively, you can allow only IP addresses from other security groups (source groups) to access the specified port:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1333(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-group-rule --ip_proto tcp --from_port 22 \\ --to_port 22 SEC_GROUP_NAME SOURCE_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1340(para) msgid "To allow pinging the instances" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1348(para) msgid "To allow pinging from IPs" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1351(para) msgid "Specify all IP addresses as IP subnet in CIDR notation: 0.0.0.0/0. This command allows access to all codes and all types of ICMP traffic, respectively:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1356(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-rule SEC_GROUP_NAME icmp -1 -1 0.0.0.0/0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1360(para) msgid "To allow pinging from other security groups" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1363(para) msgid "To allow only members of other security groups (source groups) to ping instances:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1367(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-group-rule --ip_proto icmp --from_port -1 \\ --to_port -1 SEC_GROUP_NAME SOURCE_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1374(para) msgid "To allow access through UDP port" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1377(para) msgid "To allow access through a UDP port, such as allowing access to a DNS server that runs on a VM, complete one of the following sub-steps:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1384(para) msgid "To allow UDP access from IPs" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1387(para) msgid "Specify all IP addresses as IP subnet in CIDR notation: 0.0.0.0/0." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1391(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-rule SEC_GROUP_NAME udp 53 53 0.0.0.0/0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1395(para) msgid "To allow UDP access" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1398(para) msgid "To allow only IP addresses from other security groups (source groups) to access the specified port:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1402(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-add-group-rule --ip_proto udp --from_port 53 \\ --to_port 53 SEC_GROUP_NAME SOURCE_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1409(para) msgid "To delete a security group rule, specify the same arguments that you used to create the rule." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1413(para) msgid "To delete the security rule that you created in<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/configure_security_groups_rules.html#sec_group_rule_add\">Step 3.a</link>:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1418(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-delete-rule SEC_GROUP_NAME tcp 22 22 0.0.0.0/0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1422(para) msgid "To delete the security rule that you created in<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/configure_security_groups_rules.html#sec_group_rule_add_alt\">Step 3.b</link>:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1427(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-delete-group-rule --ip_proto tcp --from_port 22 \\ --to_port 22 SEC_GROUP_NAME SOURCE_GROUP_NAME" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1433(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1795(para) msgid "Instances are virtual machines that run inside the cloud." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1435(para) msgid "Before you can launch an instance, you must gather parameters such as the image and flavor from which you want to launch your instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1438(para) msgid "You can launch an instance directly from one of the available OpenStack images or from an image that you have copied to a persistent volume. The OpenStack Image Service provides a pool of images that are accessible to members of different projects." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1443(guilabel) msgid "Gather parameters to launch an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1444(para) msgid "To launch an instance, you must specify the following parameters:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1448(para) msgid "The instance source, which is an image or snapshot. Alternatively, you can boot from a volume, which is block storage, to which you've copied an image or snapshot." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1454(para) msgid "The image or snapshot, which represents the operating system." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1458(para) msgid "A name for your instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1461(para) msgid "The flavor for your instance, which defines the compute, memory, and storage capacity of nova computing instances. A flavor is an available hardware configuration for a server. It defines the \"size\" of a virtual server that can be launched. For more details and a list of default flavors available, see Section 1.5, \"Managing Flavors,\" (⇽ User Guide for Administrators )." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1470(para) msgid "User Data is a special key in the metadata service which holds a file that cloud aware applications within the guest instance can access. For example the<link href=\"https://help.ubuntu.com/community/CloudInit\">cloudinit</link>system is an open source package from Ubuntu that handles early initialization of a cloud instance that makes use of this user data." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1479(para) msgid "Access and security credentials, which include one or both of the following credentials:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1485(para) msgid "A key-pair for your instance, which are SSH credentials that are injected into images when they are launched. For this to work, the image must contain the cloud-init package. Create at least one keypair for each project. If you already have generated a key-pair with an external tool, you can import it into OpenStack. You can use the keypair for multiple instances that belong to that project. For details, refer to Section 1.5.1, Creating or Importing Keys." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1496(para) msgid "A security group, which defines which incoming network traffic is forwarded to instances. Security groups hold a set of firewall policies, known as security group rules. For details, see xx." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1504(para) msgid "If needed, you can assign a floating (public) IP addressto a running instance and attach a block storage device, or volume, for persistent storage. For details, see Section 1.5.3, Managing IP Addresses and Section 1.7, Managing Volumes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1511(para) msgid "After you gather the parameters you need to launch an instance, you can launch it from an<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/launch_from_image\">image</link>or a<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/boot_from_volume\">volume</link>." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1517(para) msgid "To gather the parameters to launch an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1520(para) msgid "On a shell, source the OpenStack RC file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1523(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1924(para) msgid "List the available flavors:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1526(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1927(para) msgid "$ nova flavor-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1529(para) msgid "Note the ID of the flavor that you want to use for your instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1533(para) msgid "List the available images:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1536(para) msgid "$ nova image-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1539(para) msgid "You can also filter the image list by using grep to find a specific image, like this:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1543(para) msgid "$ nova image-list | grep 'kernel'" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1546(para) msgid "Note the ID of the image that you want to boot your instance from." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1550(para) msgid "List the available security groups:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1553(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-list --all-tenants" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1556(para) msgid "If you have not created any security groups, you can assign the instance to only the default security group." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1561(para) msgid "You can also list rules for a specified security group:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1565(para) msgid "$ nova secgroup-list-rules default" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1568(para) msgid "In this example, the default security group has been modified to allow HTTP traffic on the instance by permitting TCP traffic on Port 80." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1573(para) msgid "List the available keypairs." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1579(para) msgid "Note the name of the keypair that you use for SSH access." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1584(para) msgid "Use this procedure to launch an instance from an image." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1589(para) msgid "Now you have all parameters required to launch an instance, run the following command and specify the server name, flavor ID, and image ID. Optionally, you can provide a key name for access control and security group for security. You can also include metadata key and value pairs. For example you can add a description for your server by providing the --meta description=\"My Server\"parameter." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1599(para) msgid "You can pass user data in a file on your local system and pass it at instance launch by using the flag --user-data <user-data-file>." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1604(para) msgid "$ nova boot --flavor FLAVOR_ID --image IMAGE_ID --key_name KEY_NAME --user-data mydata.file \\ --security_group SEC_GROUP NAME_FOR_INSTANCE --meta KEY=VALUE --meta KEY=VALUE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1610(para) msgid "The command returns a list of server properties, depending on which parameters you provide." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1614(para) msgid "A status of BUILD indicates that the instance has started, but is not yet online." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1618(para) msgid "A status of ACTIVE indicates that your server is active." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1622(para) msgid "Copy the server ID value from the id field in the output. You use this ID to get details for or delete your server." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1627(para) msgid "Copy the administrative password value from the adminPass field. You use this value to log into your server." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1632(para) msgid "Check if the instance is online:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1638(para) msgid "This command lists all instances of the project you belong to, including their ID, their name, their status, and their private (and if assigned, their public) IP addresses." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1644(para) msgid "If the status for the instance is ACTIVE, the instance is online." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1648(para) msgid "To view the available options for the nova listcommand, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1652(para) msgid "$ nova help list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1655(para) msgid "If you did not provide a keypair, security groups, or rules, you can only access the instance from inside the cloud through VNC. Even pinging the instance is not possible." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1662(para) msgid "After you<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/create_volume_from_image\">create a bootable volume</link>, you<link href=\"http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/boot_from_volume.html#launch_image_from_volume\">launch an instance from the volume</link>." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1670(para) msgid "To create a bootable volume" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1673(para) msgid "To create a volume from an image, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1677(para) msgid "# cinder create --image-id 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9 --display-name my-bootable-vol 8" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1682(para) msgid "Optionally, to configure your volume, see the Configuring Image Service and Storage for Computechapter in the OpenStack Configuration Reference." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1687(para) msgid "To list volumes" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1690(para) msgid "Enter the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1693(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1784(para) msgid "$ nova volume-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1696(para) msgid "Copy the value in the ID field for your volume." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1704(para) msgid "Enter the nova boot command with the --block_device_mapping parameter, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1708(para) msgid "$ nova boot --flavor <flavor> --block_device_mapping <dev_name>=<id>:<type>:<size>:<delete_on_terminate> <name>" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1714(para) msgid "The command arguments are:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1717(para) msgid "--flavor flavor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1720(para) msgid "The flavor ID." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1723(para) msgid "--block_device_mapping dev- name=id:type:size:delete-on-terminate" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1729(para) msgid "dev-name. A device name where the volume is attached in the system at /dev/dev_name. This value is typically vda." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1734(para) msgid "id. The ID of the volume to boot from, as shown in the output of nova volume-list." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1738(para) msgid "type. Either snap or any other value, including a blank string. Snap means that the volume was created from a snapshot." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1743(para) msgid "size. The size of the volume, in GBs. It is safe to leave this blank and have the Compute service infer the size." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1748(para) msgid "delete-on-terminate. A boolean that indicates whether the volume should be deleted when the instance is terminated. You can specify" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1755(para) msgid "True or 1" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1758(para) msgid "False or 0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1764(para) msgid "The name for the server." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1767(para) msgid "For example, you might enter the following command to boot from a volume with ID bd7cf584-45de-44e3-bf7f-f7b50bf235e. The volume is not deleted when the instance is terminated:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1773(para) msgid "$ nova boot --flavor 2 --image 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9 --block_device_mapping vda=bd7cf584-45de-44e3-bf7f-f7b50bf235e3:::0 myInstanceFromVolume" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1780(para) msgid "Now when you list volumes, you can see that the volume is attached to a server:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1787(para) msgid "Additionally, when you list servers, you see the server that you booted from a volume:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1794(guilabel) msgid "Manage instances and hosts" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1797(guilabel) msgid "Manage IP addresses" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1798(para) msgid "Each instance can have a private, or fixed, IP address and a public, or floating, one." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1800(para) msgid "Private IP addresses are used for communication between instances, and public ones are used for communication with the outside world." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1803(para) msgid "When you launch an instance, it is automatically assigned a private IP address that stays the same until you explicitly terminate the instance. Rebooting an instance has no effect on the private IP address." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1807(para) msgid "A pool of floating IPs, configured by the cloud operator, is available in OpenStack Compute." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1809(para) msgid "You can allocate a certain number of these to a project: The maximum number of floating IP addresses per project is defined by the quota." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1812(para) msgid "You can add a floating IP address from this set to an instance of the project. To confirm the resize:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1961(para) msgid "$ nova resize-confirm 6beefcf7-9de6-48b3-9ba9-e11b343189b3" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1965(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1976(para) msgid "The server status becomes ACTIVE." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1968(para) msgid "If the resize fails or does not work as expected, you can revert the resize:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1972(para) msgid "$ nova resize-revert 6beefcf7-9de6-48b3-9ba9-e11b343189b3" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1979(guilabel) msgid "Stop and start an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1980(para) msgid "Use one of the following methods to stop and start an instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1982(guilabel) msgid "Pause and un-pause an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1983(para) msgid "To pause and un-pause a server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1986(para) msgid "To pause a server, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1989(para) msgid "$ nova pause SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1992(para) msgid "This command stores the state of the VM in RAM. A paused instance continues to run in a frozen state." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:1997(para) msgid "To un-pause the server, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2001(para) msgid "$ nova unpause SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2004(guilabel) msgid "Suspend and resume an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2005(para) msgid "To suspend and resume a server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2006(para) msgid "Administrative users might want to suspend an infrequently used instance or to perform system maintenance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2011(para) msgid "When you suspend an instance, its VM state is stored on disk, all memory is written to disk, and the virtual machine is stopped. Suspending an instance is similar to placing a device in hibernation; memory and vCPUs become available." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2018(para) msgid "To initiate a hypervisor-level suspend operation, run the following command:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2022(para) msgid "$ nova suspend SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2025(para) msgid "To resume a suspended server:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2028(para) msgid "$ nova resume SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2031(guilabel) msgid "Reboot an instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2032(para) msgid "You can perform a soft or hard reboot of a running instance. A soft reboot attempts a graceful shutdown and restart of the instance. A hard reboot power cycles the instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2036(para) msgid "To reboot a server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2039(para) msgid "By default, when you reboot a server, it is a soft reboot." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2043(para) msgid "$ nova reboot SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2046(para) msgid "To perform a hard reboot, pass the --hard parameter, as follows:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2048(para) msgid "$ nova reboot --hard SERVER" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2049(guilabel) msgid "Evacuate instances" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2050(para) msgid "If a cloud compute node fails due to a hardware malfunction or another reason, you can evacuate instances to make them available again." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2053(para) msgid "You can choose evacuation parameters for your use case." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2055(para) msgid "To preserve user data on server disk, you must configure shared storage on the target host. Also, you must validate that the current VM host is down. Otherwise the evacuation fails with an error." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2059(para) msgid "To evacuate your server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2062(para) msgid "To find a different host for the evacuated instance, run the following command to lists hosts:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2066(para) ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2243(para) msgid "$ nova host-list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2069(para) msgid "You can pass the instance password to the command by using the --password <pwd> option. If you do not specify a password, one is generated and printed after the command finishes successfully. The following command evacuates a server without shared storage:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2076(para) msgid "$ nova evacuate evacuated_server_name host_b" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2079(para) msgid "The command evacuates an instance from a down host to a specified host. The instance is booted from a new disk, but preserves its configuration including its ID, name, uid, IP address, and so on. The command returns a password:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2086(para) msgid "To preserve the user disk data on the evacuated server, deploy OpenStack Compute with shared filesystem." msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2091(para) msgid "$ nova evacuate evacuated_server_name host_b msgid "Usage from 2013-06-25 to 2013-07-24:" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2295(guilabel) msgid "Create and manage networks" msgstr "" #: ./doc/training-guides/common/module001-ch006-overview-horizon-cli.xml:2327(para) msgid "Created a new network:" msgstr "" #:
