commit_message:
Add tempest server spec

This commit adds a tempest server spec. As we discussed at Atlanta
Design summit, we should have the features of server/client/GUI of
Tempest.

Partially implements blueprint add-tempest-server

Change-Id: Ib1ec1d446c3c0fd4acb0d82d11a60863cf64e734
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/93/101093/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ================== Add Tempest Server ================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/add-tempest-server-client-gui Add Tempest Server. Problem description =================== Tempest is a great tool for verifying existing OpenStack clouds. So Tempest is not only for developers but also operators. However, it is hard to use Tempest for operators because it is difficult to use for people not familiar with the development tools such as python, testr and tempest.conf. So we should have Tempest Server, Client, GUI. It reduces obstacles for running Tempest tests. Tempest Server should be a base of the UIs. Proposed change =============== Basic design: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TempestUI Create Tempest server and its project "tempestserver" Create Tempest server --------------------- * Tempest Server should have REST APIs. + The design of REST APIs - minimum requirement The end point: v1/ - Get sets of Tempest test cases GET v1/tests Response body: sets of Tempest test cases - Execute test case(s) POST v1/test Request body: - a test configuration -> Create a tempest.conf internally based it - test regex what you want to execute Response body: - <ID>(UUID) -> This is a key for getting the status - Get the result of the execution GET v1/test/<ID> Response body: - a set of the result * Tempest Server should create tempest.conf for executing Tempest tests. + In the first implementation, users may need to specify whole tempest.conf options. * Tempest Server should have a database for storing the result of tests. + At first, we use .testrepository information directly. But in the future, we should use the common database which was already proposed[1]. [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/99339/ * Web framework + Pecan/WSME Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Masayuki Igawa <igawa@mxs.nes.nec.co.jp> We need volunteers!(TBD) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-3 Work Items ---------- - Implement Tempest server

commit_message:
Add tempest server/client/GUI spec

This commit adds a tempest server/client/GUI spec. As we discussed at
Atlanta Design summit, we should have the features of server/client/GUI
of Tempest. And this spec describes very high level design of the
features. So details should be described in other specs.

Partially implements blueprint add-tempest-server-client-gui

Change-Id: I5f0b12a3a272caa5c0d28dde84a7681f792509be

added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ========================== Add Tempest Server and GUI ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/<not-yet> Add Tempest Server and GUI. Problem description =================== Tempest is a great tool for verifying existing OpenStack clouds. So Tempest is not only for developers but also operators. However, it is hard to use Tempest for operators because it is difficult to use for people not familiar with the development tools such as python, testr and tempest.conf. So we should have Tempest Server, Client, GUI. It reduces obstacles for running Tempest tests. Proposed change =============== Basic design: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TempestUI 1. Create Tempest server 2. Create Tempest client 3. Create Tempest GUI 1. Create Tempest server ------------------------ * Tempest Server should have REST APIs. + The design of REST APIs: TBD * Tempest Server should create tempest.conf for executing Tempest tests. * Web framework + Pecan/WSME 2. Create Tempest client ------------------------ <TBD> 3. Create Tempest GUI --------------------- * This should be implemented in Horizon. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Masayuki Igawa <igawa@mxs.nes.nec.co.jp> Need volanteers!(TBD) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-2 Work Items ---------- - Implement Tempest server - Implement Tempest client - Implement Tempest GUI

"POT-Creation-Date: 2014-08-04 20:36+0000
" "PO-Revision-Date: 2014-08-05 03:50+0000
"msgstr "このイメージの起動時に 8021q カーネルを読み込むために、イメージを編集したい場合、<filename>/etc/sysconfig/modules/</filename> ディレクトリに実行可能なスクリプトを作成する必要があります。<placeholder-1/> guestfish コマンドを使用して空のファイルを作成し、<placeholder-2/> コマンドを使用して編集できます。そして、<placeholder-3/> コマンドを使用して実行可能にします。<placeholder-4/>以下の行をファイルに追加し、保存します。<placeholder-5/>続けて、実行可能にします。<placeholder-6/>"msgstr "guestfish には、非常にさまざまな機能がありますが、このドキュメントの範囲を超えています。これらのツールを用いて実行できることは、
<link href="http://libguestfs.org/guestfs-recipes.1.html">guestfs-recipes</link> を参照することを推奨します。"msgstr "いくつかの種類の変更の場合、イメージのファイルシステムを直接マウントするほうが簡単かもしれません。libguestfs プロジェクトの <placeholder-1/> プログラムにより実行できます。"msgstr "イメージがいわゆる 3 パーティション (/boot、/、swap) を持つ場合、パーティションごとに 1 つの新しいデバイスにすべきです。"msgstr "ディスクのパーティションは、さまざまな選択肢があります。デフォルトは、うまく動作する LVM パーティションを使用し、3 つのパーティション (<filename>/boot</filename>、<filename>/</filename>、swap) を作成します。この代わりに、単一の ext4 パーティション を作成し、<literal>/</literal> にマウントすることもうまく動作するでしょう。"msgstr "libvirt の「default」ネットワークが有効化されていることを確認するために、<placeholder-1/> コマンドを使用して、「default」ネットワークが有効であることを確認します。"msgstr "ネットワークが動作していない場合、以下を実行して起動します。"

commit_message:
Make doc-tools-check-languages configurable

Change-Id: Ib5ae5af106b0944cac5a10477bca448cdbf5351a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/82/111382/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BUILD_FAIL=0 CONF_FILE="doc-tools-check-languages.conf" if [[ ! -e $CONF_FILE ]]; then echo "error: the configuration file $CONF_FILE does not exist." exit 1 fi source $CONF_FILE echo echo "LANGUAGE is either 'all' or 'LANG'." echo "LANG is a language code like 'fr' or 'ja'." for language in "${!languages[@]}"; do test_language $language ${languages["$language"]} done if [[ -n ${languages[$language]} ]]; then test_language $language ${languages["$language"]} else BUILD_FAIL=1 echo "Language $language not handled" fi
deleted_lines: function test_ja { test_language 'ja' 'high-availability-guide' \ 'image-guide' 'install-guide' 'user-guide' \ 'user-guide-admin' } function test_fr { test_language 'fr' 'user-guide' } echo "LANGUAGE is either 'fr', 'ja' or 'all'."BUILD_FAIL=0 test_fr test_ja ;; fr) test_fr ;; ja) test_ja BUILD_FAIL=1 echo "Language $language not handled"

./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_customize.xml:361(code) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_customize.xml:840(code) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_log_monitor.xml:95(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_backup_recovery.xml:196(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml:1197(para) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_user_facing.xml:1216(para)msgid "The general case for this is setting key-value pairs in the aggregate metadata and matching key-value pairs in flavor's <parameter>extra_specs</parameter> metadata. The <parameter>AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter</parameter> in the filter scheduler will enforce that instances be scheduled only on hosts in aggregates that define the same key to the same value."msgid "An advanced use of this general concept allows different flavor types to run with different CPU and RAM allocation ratios so that high-intensity computing loads and low-intensity development and testing systems can share the same cloud without either starving the high-use systems or wasting resources on low-utilization systems. This works by setting <parameter>metadata</parameter> in your host aggregates and matching <parameter>extra_specs</parameter> in your flavor types."msgid "This is the first half of the equation. To get flavor types that are guaranteed a particular ratio, you must set the <parameter>extra_specs</parameter> in the flavor type to the key-value pair you want to match in the aggregate. For example, if you define <parameter>extra_specs</parameter><parameter>cpu_allocation_ratio</parameter> to \"1.0\", then instances of that type will run in aggregates only where the metadata key <parameter>cpu_allocation_ratio</parameter> is also defined as \"1.0.\" In practice, it is better to define an additional key-value pair in the aggregate metadata to match on rather than match directly on <parameter>cpu_allocation_ratio</parameter> or <parameter>core_allocation_ratio</parameter>. This allows better abstraction. For example, by defining a key <parameter>overcommit</parameter> and setting a value of \"high,\" \"medium,\" or \"low,\" you could then tune the numeric allocation ratios in the aggregates without also needing to change all flavor types relating to them."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:65(title) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_backup_recovery.xml:211(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:464(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:543(para)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_compute_nodes.xml:149(link) msgid "Hyper-V" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_network_design.xml:510(title) msgid "DNS" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_cloud_controller.xml:476(title) msgid "Application Programming Interface (API)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_cloud_controller.xml:636(term) msgid "S3" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_cloud_controller.xml:644(term) msgid "HTTP" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_log_monitor.xml:111(para) msgid "libvirt" msgstr "" #. ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7179(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7181(primary)msgid "The general case for this is setting key-value pairs in the aggregate metadata and matching key-value pairs in instance type extra specs. The AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter in the filter scheduler will enforce that instances be scheduled only on hosts in aggregates that define the same key to the same value."msgid "An advanced use of this general concept allows different instance types to run with different CPU and RAM allocation rations so that high-intensity computing loads and low-intensity development and testing systems can share the same cloud without either starving the high-use systems or wasting resources on low-utilization systems. This works by setting metadata in your host aggregates and matching extra_specs in your instance types."msgid "This is the first half of the equation. To get instance types that are guaranteed a particular ratio, you must set the extra_specs in the instance type to the key-value pair you want to match in the aggregate. For example, if you define extra specscpu_allocation_ratio to \"1.0\", then instances of that type will run in aggregates only where the metadata key cpu_allocation_ratio is also defined as \"1.0.\" In practice, it is better to define an additional key-value pair in the aggregate metadata to match on rather than match directly on cpu_allocation_ratio or core_allocation_ratio. This allows better abstraction. For example, by defining a key overcommit and setting a value of \"high,\" \"medium,\" or \"low,\" you could then tune the numeric allocation ratios in the aggregates without also needing to change all instance types relating to them."#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:65(title) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5437(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5454(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5467(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_backup_recovery.xml:211(title)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:464(para) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1348(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1350(primary)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_storage.xml:543(para) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7125(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7127(primary)#: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:13(title) msgid "Glossary" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:16(para) msgid "Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:23(link) msgid "http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:25(para) msgid "Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:33(para) msgid "This glossary offers a list of terms and definitions to define a vocabulary for OpenStack-related concepts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:35(para) msgid "To add to OpenStack glossary, clone the openstack/openstack-manuals repository and update the source file doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml through the OpenStack contribution process." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:46(title) msgid "A" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:49(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:51(primary) msgid "absolute limit" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:55(para) msgid "Impassable limits for guest VMs. Settings include total RAM size, maximum number of vCPUs, and maximum disk size." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:61(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:180(see) msgid "access control list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:63(primary) msgid "access control list (ACL)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:67(para) msgid "A list of permissions attached to an object. An ACL specifies which users or system processes have access to objects. It also defines which operations can be performed on specified objects. Each entry in a typical ACL specifies a subject and an operation. For instance, the ACL entry (Alice, delete) for a file gives Alice permission to delete the file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:77(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:79(primary) msgid "access key" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:83(para) msgid "Alternative term for an Amazon EC2 access key. See EC2 access key." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:89(glossterm) msgid "account" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:91(primary) msgid "accounts" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:95(para) msgid "The Object Storage context of an account. Do not confuse with a user account from an authentication service, such as Active Directory, /etc/passwd, OpenLDAP, OpenStack Identity Service, and so on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:102(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:104(primary) msgid "account auditor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:108(para) msgid "Checks for missing replicas and incorrect or corrupted objects in a specified Object Storage account by running queries against the back-end SQLite database." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:115(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:117(primary) msgid "account database" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:121(para) msgid "A SQLite database that contains Object Storage accounts and related metadata and that the accounts server accesses." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:127(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:129(primary) msgid "account reaper" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:133(para) msgid "An Object Storage worker that scans for and deletes account databases and that the account server has marked for deletion." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:139(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:141(primary) msgid "account server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:145(para) msgid "Lists containers in Object Storage and stores container information in the account database." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:151(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:153(primary) msgid "account service" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:157(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that provides account services such as list, create, modify, and audit. Do not confuse with OpenStack Identity Service, OpenLDAP, or similar user-account services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:164(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:166(primary) msgid "accounting" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:170(para) msgid "The Compute service provides accounting information through the event notification and system usage data facilities." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:176(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:178(primary) msgid "ACL" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:184(para) msgid "See access control list." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:189(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:191(primary) msgid "active/active configuration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:195(para) msgid "In a high-availability setup with an active/active configuration, several systems share the load together and if one fails, the load is distributed to the remaining systems." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:202(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:204(primary) msgid "Active Directory" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:208(para) msgid "Authentication and identity service by Microsoft, based on LDAP. Supported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:214(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:216(primary) msgid "active/passive configuration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:220(para) msgid "In a high-availability setup with an active/passive configuration, systems are set up to bring additional resources online to replace those that have failed." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:227(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:229(primary) msgid "address pool" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:233(para) msgid "A group of fixed and/or floating IP addresses that are assigned to a project and can be used by or assigned to the VM instances in a project." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:240(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:242(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4644(see) msgid "admin API" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:246(para) msgid "A subset of API calls that are accessible to authorized administrators and are generally not accessible to end users or the public Internet. They can exist as a separate service (keystone) or can be a subset of another API (nova)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:254(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:256(primary) msgid "admin server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:260(para) msgid "In the context of the Identity Service, the worker process that provides access to the admin API." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:266(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:269(primary) msgid "Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:273(para) msgid "The open standard messaging protocol used by OpenStack components for intra-service communications, provided by RabbitMQ, Qpid, or ZeroMQ." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:280(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:282(primary) msgid "Advanced RISC Machine (ARM)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:286(para) msgid "Lower power consumption CPU often found in mobile and embedded devices. Supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:292(glossterm) msgid "alert" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:294(primary) msgid "alerts" msgstr "" #: For example, example.com/nova/v1/foobar." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:517(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:519(primary) msgid "applet" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:523(para) msgid "A Java program that can be embedded into a web page." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:528(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_cloud_controller.xml:476(title) msgid "Application Programming Interface (API)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:531(para) msgid "A collection of specifications used to access a service, application, or program. Used along with iptables, ebtables, and ip6tables in Compute to provide firewall services for VMs." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:582(glossterm) msgid "associate" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:584(primary) msgid "associate, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:588(para) msgid "The process associating a Compute floating IP address with a fixed IP address." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:594(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:597(primary) msgid "Asynchronous JavaScript and XML (AJAX)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:601(para) msgid "A group of interrelated web development techniques used on the client-side to create asynchronous web applications. Used extensively in horizon." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:608(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:610(primary) msgid "ATA over Ethernet (AoE)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:614(para) msgid "A disk storage protocol tunneled within Ethernet." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:619(glossterm) msgid "attach" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:621(primary) msgid "attach, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:625(para) msgid "The process of connecting a VIF or vNIC to a L2 network in Networking. In the context of Compute, this process connects a storage volume to an instance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:632(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:634(primary) msgid "attachment (network)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:638(para) msgid "Association of an interface ID to a logical port. Plugs an interface into a port." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:644(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:646(primary) msgid "auditing" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:650(para) msgid "Provided in Compute through the system usage data facility." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:656(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:658(primary) msgid "auditor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:662(para) msgid "A worker process that verifies the integrity of Object Storage objects, containers, and accounts. Auditors is the collective term for the Object Storage account auditor, container auditor, and object auditor." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:676(para) msgid "The code name for the initial release of OpenStack. The first design summit took place in Austin, Texas, US." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:683(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:685(primary) msgid "auth node" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:689(para) msgid "Alternative term for an Object Storage authorization node." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:695(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:697(primary) msgid "authentication" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:701(para) msgid "The process that confirms that the user, process, or client is really who they say they are through private key, secret token, password, fingerprint, or similar method." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:708(glossterm) msgid "authentication token" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:710(primary) msgid "authentication tokens" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:714(para) msgid "A string of text provided to the client after authentication. Must be provided by the user or process in subsequent requests to the API endpoint." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:721(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:723(primary) msgid "AuthN" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:727(para) msgid "The Identity Service component that provides authentication services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:733(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:735(primary) msgid "authorization" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:739(para) msgid "The act of verifying that a user, process, or client is authorized to perform an action." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:745(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:747(primary) msgid "authorization node" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:751(para) msgid "An Object Storage node that provides authorization services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:757(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:759(primary) msgid "AuthZ" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:763(para) msgid "The Identity Service component that provides high-level authorization services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:769(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:771(primary) msgid "Auto ACK" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:775(para) msgid "Configuration setting within RabbitMQ that enables or disables message acknowledgment. Enabled by default." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:781(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:783(primary) msgid "auto declare" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:787(para) msgid "A Compute RabbitMQ setting that determines whether a message exchange is automatically created when the program starts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:793(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:795(primary) msgid "availability zone" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:799(para) msgid "An Amazon EC2 concept of an isolated area that is used for fault tolerance. Do not confuse with an OpenStack Compute zone or cell." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:806(glossterm) msgid "AWS" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:808(primary) msgid "AWS (Amazon Web Services)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:812(para) msgid "Amazon Web Services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:820(title) msgid "B" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:823(glossterm) msgid "back end" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:825(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:840(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:856(primary) msgid "back-end interactions" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:831(para) msgid "Interactions and processes that are obfuscated from the user, such as Compute volume mount, data transmission to an iSCSI target by a daemon, or Object Storage object integrity checks." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:838(glossterm) msgid "back-end catalog" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:842(secondary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1254(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1256(primary) msgid "catalog" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:846(para) msgid "The storage method used by the Identity Service catalog service to store and retrieve information about API endpoints that are available to the client. Examples include a SQL database, LDAP database, or KVS back end." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:854(glossterm) msgid "back-end store" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:858(secondary) msgid "store" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:862(para) msgid "The persistent data store used to save and retrieve information for a service, such as lists of Object Storage objects, current state of guest VMs, lists of user names, and so on. Also, the method that the Image Service uses to get and store VM images. Options include Object Storage, local file system, S3, and HTTP." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:871(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:873(primary) msgid "bandwidth" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:879(para) msgid "The amount of available data used by communication resources, such as the Internet. Represents the amount of data that is used to download things or the amount of data available to download." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:886(glossterm) msgid "bare" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:888(primary) msgid "bare, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:892(para) msgid "An Image Service container format that indicates that no container exists for the VM image." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:898(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:900(primary) msgid "base image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:904(para) msgid "An OpenStack-provided image." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:909(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:911(primary) msgid "Bell-LaPadula model" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:915(para) msgid "A security model that focuses on data confidentiality and controlled access to classified information. This model divide the entities into subjects and objects. The clearance of a subject is compared to the classification of the object to determine if the subject is authorized for the specific access mode. The clearance or classification scheme is expressed in terms of a lattice." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:931(para) msgid "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in February of 2011. It included only Compute (nova) and Object Storage (swift)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:934(para) msgid "Bexar is the code name for the second release of OpenStack. The design summit took place in San Antonio, Texas, US, which is the county seat for Bexar county." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:941(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:943(primary) msgid "binary" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:949(para) msgid "Information that consists solely of ones and zeroes, which is the language of computers." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:955(glossterm) msgid "bit" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:957(primary) msgid "bits, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:961(para) msgid "A bit is a single digit number that is in base of 2 (either a zero or one). Bandwidth usage is measured in bits per second." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:967(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:969(primary) msgid "bits per second (BPS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:973(para) msgid "The universal measurement of how quickly data is transferred from place to place." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:979(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:981(primary) msgid "block device" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:985(para) msgid "A device that moves data in the form of blocks. These device nodes interface the devices, such as hard disks, CD-ROM drives, flash drives, and other addressable regions of memory." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:992(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:994(primary) msgid "block migration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:998(para) msgid "A method of VM live migration used by KVM to evacuate instances from one host to another with very little downtime during a user-initiated switchover. Does not require shared storage. Supported by Compute." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1012(para) msgid "The OpenStack core project that enables management of volumes, volume snapshots, and volume types. The project name of Block Storage is cinder." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1019(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1021(primary) msgid "Block Storage API" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1025(para) msgid "An API on a separate endpoint for attaching, detaching, and creating block storage for compute VMs." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1032(glossterm) msgid "BMC" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1034(primary) msgid "BMC (Baseboard Management Controller)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1038(para) msgid "Baseboard Management Controller. The intelligence in the IPMI architecture, which is a specialized micro-controller that is embedded on the motherboard of a computer and acts as a server. Manages the interface between system management software and platform hardware." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1047(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1049(primary) msgid "bootable disk image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1053(para) msgid "A type of VM image that exists as a single, bootable file." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1059(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1061(primary) msgid "Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1065(para) msgid "A network protocol used by a network client to obtain an IP address from a configuration server. Provided in Compute through the dnsmasq daemon when using either the FlatDHCP manager or VLAN manager network manager." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1073(glossterm) msgid "browser" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1075(primary) msgid "browsers, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1079(para) msgid "Any client software that enables a computer or device to access the Internet." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1085(glossterm) msgid "builder file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1087(primary) msgid "builder files" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1091(para) msgid "Contains configuration information that Object Storage uses to reconfigure a ring or to re-create it from scratch after a serious failure." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1098(glossterm) msgid "button class" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1100(primary) msgid "button classes" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1104(para) msgid "A group of related button types within horizon. Buttons to start, stop, and suspend VMs are in one class. Buttons to associate and disassociate floating IP addresses are in another class, and so on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1112(glossterm) msgid "byte" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1114(primary) msgid "bytes, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1118(para) msgid "Set of bits that make up a single character; there are usually 8 bits to a byte." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1127(title) msgid "C" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1130(glossterm) msgid "CA" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1132(primary) msgid "CA (Certificate/Certification Authority)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1136(para) msgid "Certificate Authority or Certification Authority. In cryptography, an entity that issues digital certificates. The digital certificate certifies the ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate. This enables others (relying parties) to rely upon signatures or assertions made by the private key that corresponds to the certified public key. In this model of trust relationships, a CA is a trusted third party for both the subject (owner) of the certificate and the party relying upon the certificate. CAs are characteristic of many public key infrastructure (PKI) schemes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1150(glossterm) msgid "cache pruner" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1152(primary) msgid "cache pruners" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1156(para) msgid "A program that keeps the Image Service VM image cache at or below its configured maximum size." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1168(para) msgid "An OpenStack grouped release of projects that came out in the spring of 2011. It included Compute (nova), Object Storage (swift), and the Image Service (glance)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1171(para) msgid "Cactus is a city in Texas, US and is the code name for the third release of OpenStack. When OpenStack releases went from three to six months long, the code name of the release changed to match a geography nearest the previous summit." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1179(glossterm) msgid "CADF" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1181(para) msgid "Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) is a specification for audit event data. CADF is supported by OpenStack Identity." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1190(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1192(primary) msgid "CALL" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1196(para) msgid "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. Sends a message and waits for a response." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1202(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1204(primary) msgid "capability" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1210(para) msgid "Defines resources for a cell, including CPU, storage, and networking. Can apply to the specific services within a cell or a whole cell." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1217(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1219(primary) msgid "capacity cache" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1223(para) msgid "A Compute back-end database table that contains the current workload, amount of free RAM, and number of VMs running on each host. Used to determine on which VM a host starts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1230(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1232(primary) msgid "capacity updater" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1236(para) msgid "A notification driver that monitors VM instances and updates the capacity cache as needed." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1242(glossterm) msgid "CAST" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1244(primary) msgid "CAST (RPC primitive)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1248(para) msgid "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1896(glossterm) msgid "container server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1900(secondary) msgid "container servers" msgstr ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1938(primary) msgid "core API" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1942(para) msgid "Depending on context, the core API is either the OpenStack API or the main API of a specific core project, such as Compute, Networking, Image Service, and so on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1949(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1951(primary) msgid "core project" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1955(para) msgid "An official OpenStack project. Currently consists of Compute (nova), Object Storage (swift), Image Service (glance), Identity (keystone), Dashboard (horizon), Networking (neutron), and Block Storage (cinder). The Telemetry module (ceilometer) and Orchestration module (heat) are integrated projects as of the Havana release. In the Icehouse release, the Database module (trove) gains integrated project status." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1966(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1968(primary) msgid "cost" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1972(para) msgid "Under the Compute distributed scheduler, this is calculated by looking at the capabilities of each host relative to the flavor of the VM instance being requested." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1979(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1981(primary) msgid "credentials" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1985(para) msgid "Data that is only known to or accessible by a user and used to verify that the user is who he says he is. Credentials are presented to the server during authentication. Examples include a password, secret key, digital certificate, and fingerprint." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1993(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1995(primary) msgid "Crowbar" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:1999(para) msgid "An open source community project by Dell that aims to provide all necessary services to quickly deploy clouds." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2005(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2007(primary) msgid "current workload" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2011(para) msgid "An element of the Compute capacity cache that is calculated based on the number of build, snapshot, migrate, and resize operations currently in progress on a given host." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2018(glossterm) msgid "customer" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2020(primary) msgid "customers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2022(see) msgid "tenants" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2026(para) msgid "Alternative term for tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2031(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2033(primary) msgid "customization module" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2037(para) msgid "A user-created Python module that is loaded by horizon to change the look and feel of the dashboard." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2046(title) msgid "D" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2049(glossterm) msgid "daemon" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2051(primary) msgid "daemons" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2057(para) msgid "A process that runs in the background and waits for requests. May or may not listen on a TCP or UDP port. Do not confuse with a worker." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2064(glossterm) msgid "DAC" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2066(primary) msgid "DAC (discretionary access control)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2070(para) msgid "Discretionary access control. Governs the ability of subjects to access objects, while enabling users to make policy decisions and assign security attributes. The traditional UNIX system of users, groups, and read-write-execute permissions is an example of DAC." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2079(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2081(primary) msgid "dashboard" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2085(para) msgid "The web-based management interface for OpenStack. "Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. A network protocol that configures devices that are connected to a network so that they can communicate on that network by using the Internet Protocol (IP). The protocol is implemented in a client-server model where DHCP clients request configuration data, such as an IP address, a default route, and one or more DNS server addresses from a DHCP server." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2331(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2333(primary) msgid "DHCP agent" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2337(para) msgid "OpenStack Networking agent that provides DHCP services for virtual networks." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2349(para) msgid "A grouped release of projects related to OpenStack that came out in the fall of 2011, the fourth release of OpenStack. Often, the domain name has two or more parts that are separated by dots. For example, yahoo.com, usa.gov, harvard.edu, or mail.yahoo.com." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2513(para) msgid "A domain is an entity or container of all DNS-related information containing one or more records." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2519(glossterm) msgid "Domain Name Service (DNS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2522(para) msgid "In Compute, the support that enables associating DNS entries with floating IP addresses, nodes, or cells so that hostnames are consistent across reboots." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2529(glossterm) msgid "Domain Name System (DNS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2532(para) msgid "A system by which Internet domain name-to-address and address-to-name resolutions are determined." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2535(para) msgid "DNS helps navigate the Internet by translating the IP address into an address that is easier to remember For example, translating 111.111.111.1 into www.yahoo.com." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2539(para) msgid "All domains and their components, such as mail servers, utilize DNS to resolve to the appropriate locations. DNS servers are usually set up in a master-slave relationship such that failure of the master invokes the slave. DNS servers might also be clustered or replicated such that changes made to one DNS server are automatically propagated to other active servers." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2549(glossterm) msgid "download" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2551(primary) msgid "download, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2555(para) msgid "The transfer of data, usually in the form of files, from one computer to another." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2561(glossterm) msgid "DRTM" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2563(primary) msgid "DRTM (dynamic root of trust measurement)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2567(para) msgid "Dynamic root of trust measurement." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2572(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2574(primary) msgid "durable exchange" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2578(para) msgid "The Compute RabbitMQ message exchange that remains active when the server restarts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2584(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2586(primary) msgid "durable queue" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2590(para) msgid "A Compute RabbitMQ message queue that remains active when the server restarts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2596(glossterm) msgid "Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:2599(para) msgid "A method to automatically configure networking for a host at boot time. HTTP is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. It is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web. Hypertext is structured text that uses logical links (hyperlinks) between nodes containing text. HTTP is the protocol to exchange or transfer hypertext." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3655(glossterm) msgid "HTTPS" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3657(primary) msgid "HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3661(para) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is a communications protocol for secure communication over a computer network, with especially wide deployment on the Internet. Technically, it is not a protocol in and of itself; rather, it is the result of simply layering the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) on top of the SSL/TLS protocol, thus adding the security capabilities of SSL/TLS to standard HTTP communications." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3672(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3674(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/ch_arch_compute_nodes.xml:149(link) msgid "Hyper-V" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3678(para) msgid "One of the hypervisors supported by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3683(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3685(primary) msgid "hyperlink" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3689(para) msgid "Any kind of text that contains a link to some other site, commonly found in documents where clicking on a word or words opens up a different website." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3696(glossterm) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3699(para) msgid "The protocol that tells browsers where to go to find information." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3705(glossterm) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3708(para) msgid "Encrypted HTTP communications using SSL or TLS; most OpenStack API endpoints and many inter-component communications support HTTPS communication." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3715(glossterm) msgid "hypervisor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3717(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3731(primary) msgid "hypervisors" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3723(para) msgid "Software that arbitrates and controls VM access to the actual underlying hardware." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3729(glossterm) msgid "hypervisor pool" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3733(secondary) msgid "hypervisor pools" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3737(para) msgid "A collection of hypervisors grouped together through host aggregates." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3746(title) msgid "I" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3749(glossterm) msgid "IaaS" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3751(primary) msgid "IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3757(para) msgid "Infrastructure-as-a-Service. IaaS is a provisioning model in which an organization outsources physical components of a data center, such as storage, hardware, servers, and networking components. A service provider owns the equipment and is responsible for housing, operating and maintaining it. The client typically pays on a per-use basis. IaaS is a model for providing cloud services." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3775(para) msgid "The code name for the ninth release of OpenStack. The design summit took place in Hong Kong and Ice House is a street in that city." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3782(glossterm) msgid "ICMP" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3784(primary) msgid "Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:3788(para) msgid "Internet Control Message Protocol, used by network devices for control messages. Different kernel modules and programs are currently used for different protocols: iptables applies to IPv4, ip6tables to IPv6, arptables to ARP, and ebtables to Ethernet frames. Enables images to be shared with specified tenants." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4746(glossterm) msgid "membership list" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4748(primary) msgid "membership lists" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4758(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4760(primary) msgid "memcached" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4764(para) msgid "A distributed memory object caching system that is used by Object Storage for caching." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4770(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4772(primary) msgid "memory overcommit" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4776(para) msgid "The ability to start new VM instances based on the actual memory usage of a host, as opposed to basing the decision on the amount of RAM each running instance thinks it has available. Also known as RAM overcommit." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4784(glossterm) msgid "message broker" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4786(primary) msgid "message brokers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4790(para) msgid "The software package used to provide AMQP messaging capabilities within Compute. Each compute node handles NAT and DHCP and acts as a gateway for all of the VMs on it. A networking failure on one compute node doesn't affect VMs on other compute nodes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4869(glossterm) msgid "multinic" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4872(para) msgid "Facility in Compute that allows each virtual machine instance to have more than one VIF connected to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4878(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4881(primary) msgid "Modular Layer 2 (ML2) neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4885(para) msgid "Can concurrently use multiple layer-2 networking technologies, such as 802.1Q and VXLAN, in Networking." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4891(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4893(primary) msgid "Monitor (LBaaS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4897(para) msgid "LBaaS feature that provides availability monitoring using the ping command, TCP, and HTTP/HTTPS GET." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4903(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4905(primary) msgid "Monitor (Mon)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4909(para) msgid "A Ceph component that communicates with external clients, checks data state and consistency, and performs quorum functions." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4915(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4917(primary) msgid "multi-factor authentication" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4921(para) msgid "Authentication method that uses two or more credentials, such as a password and a private key. Currently not supported in Identity Service." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4928(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4930(primary) msgid "MultiNic" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4934(para) msgid "Facility in Compute that enables a virtual machine instance to have more than one VIF connected to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4943(title) msgid "N" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4946(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4948(primary) msgid "Nebula" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4952(para) msgid "Released as open source by NASA in 2010 and is the basis for Compute." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4958(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4960(primary) msgid "netadmin" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:4964(para) msgid "One of the default roles in the Compute RBAC system. For example, a collection of virtual ports that share network connectivity. In Networking terminology, a network is always a layer-2 network." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5000(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5004(secondary) msgid "Network Address Translation (NAT)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5008(para) msgid "The process of modifying IP address information while in transit. Same as network UUID." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5057(glossterm) msgid "network manager" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5061(secondary) msgid "network managers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5065(para) msgid "The Compute component that manages various network components, such as firewall rules, IP address allocation, and so on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5071(glossterm) msgid "network node" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5075(secondary) msgid "network nodes" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5079(para) msgid "Any compute node that runs the network worker daemon." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5084(glossterm) msgid "network segment" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5088(secondary) msgid "network segments" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5092(para) msgid "Represents a virtual, isolated OSI layer-2 subnet in Networking." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5098(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5102(secondary) msgid "Network Time Protocol (NTP)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5106(para) msgid "A method of keeping a clock for a host or node correct through communications with a trusted, accurate time source." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5112(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5116(secondary) msgid "network UUID" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5120(para) msgid "Unique ID for a Networking network segment." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5126(glossterm) msgid "network worker" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5130(secondary) msgid "network workers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5134(para) msgid "The nova-network worker daemon; This is the legacy networking option and an alternative to Networking." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5336(title) msgid "O" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5339(glossterm) msgid "object" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5347(para) msgid "A BLOB of data held by Object Storage; can be in any format." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5353(glossterm) msgid "object auditor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5357(secondary) msgid "object auditors" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5361(para) msgid "Opens all objects for an object server and verifies the MD5 hash, size, and metadata for each object." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5367(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5371(secondary) msgid "object expiration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5375(para) msgid "A configurable option within Object Storage to automatically delete objects after a specified amount of time has passed or a certain date is reached." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5382(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5386(secondary) msgid "object hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5390(para) msgid "Uniquely ID for an Object Storage object." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5395(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5399(secondary) msgid "object path hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5403(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine the location of an object in the ring. Maps objects to partitions." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5409(glossterm) msgid "object replicator" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5413(secondary) msgid "object replicators" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5417(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that copies an object to remote partitions for fault tolerance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5423(glossterm) msgid "object server" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5427(secondary) msgid "object servers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5431(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that is responsible for managing objects." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5440(para) msgid "The OpenStack core project that provides eventually consistent and redundant storage and retrieval of fixed digital content. The project name of OpenStack Object Storage is swift." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5447(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5451(secondary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5456(secondary) msgid "Object Storage API" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5449(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7487(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7510(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7524(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:7548(primary) msgid "swift" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5460(para) msgid "API used to access OpenStack Object Storage." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5465(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5469(secondary) msgid "Object Storage Device (OSD)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5473(para) msgid "The Ceph storage daemon." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5478(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5482(secondary) msgid "object versioning" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5486(para) msgid "Allows a user to set a flag on an Object Storage container so that all objects within the container are versioned." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5492(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5494(primary) msgid "Oldie" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5498(para) msgid "Term for an Object Storage process that runs for a long time. Can indicate a hung process." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5504(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5507(primary) msgid "Open Cloud Computing Interface (OCCI)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5511(para) msgid "A standardized interface for managing compute, data, and network resources, currently unsupported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5517(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5519(primary) msgid "Open Virtualization Format (OVF)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5523(para) msgid "Standard for packaging VM images. Supported in OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5528(glossterm) msgid "Open vSwitch neutron plug-in" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5530(primary) msgid "Open vSwitch" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5536(para) msgid "Provides support for Open vSwitch in Networking." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5541(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5543(primary) msgid "OpenLDAP" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5547(para) msgid "An open source LDAP server. Supported by both Compute and Identity Service." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5561(para) msgid "OpenStack is a cloud operating system that controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their users to provision resources through a web interface. OpenStack is an open source project licensed under the Apache License 2.0." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5571(glossterm) msgid "OpenStack code name" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5574(secondary) msgid "code name" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5578(para) msgid "Each OpenStack release has a code name. Code names ascend in alphabetical order: Austin, Bexar, Cactus, Diablo, Essex, Folsom, Grizzly, Havana, Icehouse, Juno, and Kilo. Code names are cities or counties near where the corresponding OpenStack design summit took place. An exception, called the Waldon exception, is granted to elements of the state flag that sound especially cool. Code names are chosen by popular vote." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5592(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5594(primary) msgid "openSUSE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5603(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5605(primary) msgid "operator" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5609(para) msgid "The person responsible for planning and maintaining an OpenStack installation." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5615(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5617(primary) msgid "Orchestration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5621(para) msgid "An integrated project that orchestrates multiple cloud applications for OpenStack. The project name of Orchestration is heat." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5628(glossterm) msgid "orphan" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5630(primary) msgid "orphans" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5634(para) msgid "In the context of Object Storage, this is a process that is not terminated after an upgrade, restart, or reload of the service." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5643(title) msgid "P" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5646(glossterm) msgid "parent cell" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5650(secondary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5653(primary) msgid "parent cells" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5657(para) msgid "If a requested resource, such as CPU time, disk storage, or memory, is not available in the parent cell, the request is forwarded to associated child cells." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5664(glossterm) msgid "partition" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5666(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5681(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5695(primary) msgid "partitions" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5672(para) msgid "A unit of storage within Object Storage used to store objects. It exists on top of devices and is replicated for fault tolerance." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5679(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5683(secondary) msgid "partition index" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5687(para) msgid "Contains the locations of all Object Storage partitions within the ring." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5693(glossterm) msgid "partition shift value" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5697(secondary) msgid "partition index value" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5701(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine which partition data should reside on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5707(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5709(primary) msgid "pause" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5713(para) msgid "A VM state where no changes occur (no changes in memory, network communications stop, etc); the VM is frozen but not shut down." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5719(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5721(primary) msgid "PCI passthrough" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5725(para) msgid "Gives guest VMs exclusive access to a PCI device. Currently supported in OpenStack Havana and later releases." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5731(glossterm) msgid "persistent message" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5735(secondary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5738(primary) msgid "persistent messages" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5742(para) msgid "A message that is stored both in memory and on disk. The message is not lost after a failure or restart." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5748(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5750(primary) msgid "persistent volume" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5754(para) msgid "Changes to these types of disk volumes are saved." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5759(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5761(primary) msgid "personality file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5765(para) msgid "A file used to customize a Compute instance. It can be used to inject SSH keys or a specific network configuration." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5771(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5773(primary) msgid "Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5777(para) msgid "Provides to the consumer the ability to deploy applications through a programming language or tools supported by the cloud platform provider. An example of Platform-as-a-Service is an Eclipse/Java programming platform provided with no downloads required." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5786(glossterm) msgid "plug-in" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5788(primary) msgid "plug-ins, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5792(para) msgid "Software component providing the actual implementation for Networking APIs, or for Compute APIs, depending on the context." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5798(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5800(primary) msgid "policy service" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5804(para) msgid "Component of Identity Service that provides a rule-management interface and a rule-based authorization engine." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5810(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5812(primary) msgid "pool" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5816(para) msgid "A logical set of devices, such as web servers, that you group together to receive and process traffic. The load balancing function chooses which member of the pool handles the new requests or connections received on the VIP address. Each VIP has one pool." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5825(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5827(primary) msgid "pool member" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5831(para) msgid "An application that runs on the back-end server in a load-balancing system." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5837(glossterm) msgid "port" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5839(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5853(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:8084(primary) msgid "ports" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5845(para) msgid "A virtual network port within Networking; VIFs / vNICs are connected to a port." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5851(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5855(secondary) msgid "port UUID" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5859(para) msgid "Unique ID for a Networking port." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5864(glossterm) msgid "preseed" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5866(primary) msgid "preseed, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5870(para) msgid "A tool to automate system configuration and installation on Debian-based Linux distributions." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5876(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5878(primary) msgid "private image" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5882(para) msgid "An Image Service VM image that is only available to specified tenants." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5888(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5895(primary) msgid "private IP address" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5892(secondary) msgid "private" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5899(para) msgid "An IP address used for management and administration, not available to the public Internet." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5905(glossterm) msgid "private network" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5909(secondary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5912(primary) msgid "private networks" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5916(para) msgid "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to enable compute servers to interact with each other and with the public network. All machines must have a public and private network interface. A private network interface can be a flat or VLAN network interface. A flat network interface is controlled by the flat_interface with flat managers. A VLAN network interface is controlled by the vlan_interface option with VLAN managers." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5928(glossterm) msgid "project" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5930(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5944(primary) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5958(primary) msgid "projects" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5936(para) msgid "A logical grouping of users within Compute; defines quotas and access to VM images." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5942(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5946(secondary) msgid "project ID" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5950(para) msgid "User-defined alphanumeric string in Compute; the name of a project." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5956(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5960(secondary) msgid "project VPN" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5964(para) msgid "Alternative term for a cloudpipe." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5969(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5971(primary) msgid "promiscuous mode" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5975(para) msgid "Causes the network interface to pass all traffic it receives to the host rather than passing only the frames addressed to it." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5982(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5984(primary) msgid "protected property" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5988(para) msgid "Generally, extra properties on an Image Service image to which only cloud administrators have access. Limits which user roles can perform CRUD operations on that property. The cloud administrator can configure any image property as protected." msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5997(glossterm) ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:5999(primary) msgid ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:6112(primary) msgid "public network" msgstr "" #: ./doc/openstack-ops/glossary-terms.xml:6116(para) msgid "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to All machines must have a public and private network interface.
